incident: Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Lay in in the early stages of the Home Straight.  Had some difficulty obtaining clear running between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres when being shifted to the outside of SEA SAPPHIRE and CALIFORNIA DEEPLY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Noted to have sustained a small laceration to the right front cannon.  K C Leung was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres.    Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly.
After the event J Orman stated that it was not the intention to lead but after his mount commenced well it showed sufficient pace to hold the lead without being unduly pressured to do so.
Jumped awkwardly.
Approaching the winning post could not be fully ridden out when placed in restricted room between SONIC BOOM and SPEEDY SMARTIE which shifted out slightly.
Over the concluding stages was steadied when awkwardly placed close to SONIC BOOM which shifted in.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 800 Metres was steadied away from ORIENTAL SURPRISE.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Had its right hind plate adjusted in the Parade Ring, was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and passed suitable to race.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when held up behind KA YING RESILIENCE.
No report.

Lay in when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and near the 100 Metres was corrected by its rider.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when awkwardly placed close to the heels of PATCH OF WATCH.  After the event L Ferraris stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily during the race but did not respond to his riding over the final 200 Metres of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event M L Yeung stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and, in his opinion, may be better suited by being stepped back up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position and as a result was obliged to race very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Jumped only fairly.

Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  After the event M F Poon reported that his mount was slow to begin and settled further back than intended.  He added THE CONCENTRATION finished the race off fairly in the Home Straight and would appreciate being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a minor laceration to the left hock.
Shortly after the start was steadied when momentarily crowded between ORIENTAL SURPRISE and SPEEDY SMARTIE.
Sent for sampling post-race. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.
Held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 250 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied to avoid WAH MAY WAI WAI and shifted to that runner’s inside to continue into clear running.
Jumped only fairly.
After the event Z Purton stated that when his mount commenced well today it was able to hold a more forward position than it had at its previous two race starts.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start shifted out, made contact with TIER FLY and became slightly unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
The tongue tie was replaced at the Start.
No report.
Shortly after the start was crowded between AKASHVANI and LO PAN SPIRIT, both of which shifted ground.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

After the event L Ferraris stated that his mount travelled well during the race.  He added when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount did not change lead leg as he had expected and finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse had returned an abnormal heart rate requiring further assessment.  Following further assessment of the abnormal heart rate, the Stewards will consider if any further action is taken against the horse.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event K C Leung stated that his mount was stirred up prior to the race.  He added the horse set a strong tempo in the lead but when under pressure in the Home Straight gave ground and may not have been entirely comfortable on the track which was rain affected.  He also indicated that the horse may derive benefit from today’s performance.  Trainer W K Mo concurred with the views of Jockey Leung.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

After the event Y L Chung stated that his mount may not have appreciated the track condition which was rain affected.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, YOUNG SUPERSTAR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 500 Metres shifted out and made contact with the running rail.  Approaching the 50 Metres was held up for clear running behind SUPER STRONG KID.  When being shifted to the inside of SUPER STRONG KID, RISING PHOENIX made contact with PARENTS’ LOVE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 50 Metres was bumped by RISING PHOENIX which was shifted to the inside of SUPER STRONG KID to obtain clear running.
Bumped heavily on jumping.  Near the 250 Metres was shifted to the inside of PARENTS’ LOVE to continue into clear running and made contact with BEAUTY THUNDER.
Near the 250 Metres was bumped by WATCH THIS ONE which shifted to the inside of PARENTS’ LOVE to continue into clear running.
Jumped awkwardly and shortly after became unbalanced when bumped heavily by OWNERS’ SUNSHINE.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by DR GOLDEN GENERAL which shifted out.  Lay out under pressure over the final 300 Metres and proved difficult to ride out.
No report.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.

As K C Leung was unable to fulfil the engagement on MARKWIN due to being overweight, H Bentley was substituted as the rider of that horse.  Jockey Leung was fined the sum of $5,000.  Near the 100 Metres shifted in and made contact with PRAY FOR MIR.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between MICKLEY and HEALTHY HAPPY, both of which shifted ground.  For a short distance near the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of WONDER KIT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
For some distance near the 100 Metres raced in restricted room between FAST NETWORK which shifted out and MARKWIN which shifted in, resulting in PRAY FOR MIR becoming slightly unbalanced.

Near the 100 Metres shifted out under pressure and made contact with PRAY FOR MIR.  After the event Z Purton stated that from the outside barrier he was given the option of taking up a forward position if his mount commenced well.  He said when FAST NETWORK was able to jump well from its starting gates he elected to take advantage of the good start to hold a position outside the lead.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions issued and stated that as the race did not appear to be overly fast he had given Jockey Purton the option of holding a more forward position, particularly due to the horse being up in distance today.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start. A Atzeni was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

After the event B Avdulla reported that, in his opinion, the horse would derive benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the event K Teetan reported that his mount was disadvantaged by being taken on in the lead by FAST NETWORK and as a consequence was unable to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

Withdrawn on 6.9.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, THE GOLDEN SCENERY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 250 Metres rider K C Leung dropped his whip.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly. Y L Chung was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 4 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.
No report.
No report.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running and when being shifted across the heels of HARMONY N BLESSED, RAGING BLIZZARD blundered.

Near the 800 Metres BEAUTY WAVES, which  was racing keenly, was checked to avoid BOTTOMUPTOGETHER (M F Poon) which shifted in when not clear as its rider eased the pace.  M F Poon was reprimanded.  After the event A Badel stated that his mount jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  He said in the early stages BEAUTY WAVES then raced keenly and after being checked making the first turn finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
The explanation provided by Jockey K De Melo for returning to scale overweight was accepted.

Approaching the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded by GORGEOUS WIN (Apprentice P N Wong) which shifted in.  Whilst the Stewards accepted that Apprentice Wong had made some effort to prevent her mount from shifting in she was advised to exercise more care.
Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres rider H Bentley had difficulty fully testing his mount when his whip became entangled in his rein.
Jumped awkwardly.  Between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres was held up for clear running.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.
Bumped at the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running behind HARMONY FIRE.  After being shifted to the inside of HARMONY FIRE leaving the 150 Metres then raced tight to that runner’s inside for a short distance thereafter when HARMONY FIRE shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.  In the middle stages raced keenly.  For some distance near the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid PLENTIFUL.  Near the 300 Metres made contact with GRAND NOVA when being shifted to the outside of PLENTIFUL to obtain clear running.  For some distance near the 200 Metres MOON ROCKET then raced in restricted room between GRAND NOVA and PLENTIFUL, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Over the concluding stages shifted in, resulting in its rider M F Poon having to stop riding with the whip and correct his mount.
Near the 300 Metres and again near the 200 Metres bumped with MOON ROCKET.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Over the final 50 Metres could not be fully ridden out when held up behind HARMONY FIRE.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Leaving the 600 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid HARMONY FIRE.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when racing in restricted room between SERGEANT PEPPER and MOON ROCKET which shifted in slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping made contact with the left side of its barrier.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running after the 250 Metres when being shifted to the outside of MOON ROCKET and GRAND NOVA to obtain clear running.
No report.

After the event A Atzeni stated that the intention was to hold a forward position but when his mount bounded as the start was effected, it lost ground and settled further back in the field than intended.
Jumped awkwardly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When being shifted across behind runners in the early stages raced keenly and got its head up.
On jumping was bumped by MOON ROCKET which shifted in, resulting in ROMANTIC PARTY becoming unbalanced.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Slow to begin.  Approaching the 50 Metres M F Poon dropped his right rein for a number of strides.  After the event M F Poon stated that his mount did not stretch out during the running of the race and he had some concern with its action.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

After the event J Orman stated that, in his opinion, the horse would derive benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Shortly after the start was bumped by RUN YES RUN when racing in restricted room between RUN YES RUN and SUPER CHARIZZARD.  Sent for sampling post-race. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between RUN YES RUN and GLORIOUS EXPERT which shifted out.  Between the 300 Metres and passing the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.  After the 200 Metres TALENTS SUPREMO was steadied when crowded by DAN ATTACK (H Bowman) which shifted in slightly.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  TALENTS SUPREMO was then shifted to the outside of DAN ATTACK where it obtained clear running near the 150 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with NOBLE GO.  RAGNARR was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages from a wide barrier.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Y L Chung was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height in the Home Straight.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when held up behind WOODFIRE CHAMP.  After the event H Bentley reported that his mount lay out when placed under pressure in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  For some distance near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid WOODFIRE CHAMP.
No report.
After the event Z Purton stated that he was satisfied with his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Made contact with the rail with its right hind leg when entering the track.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and found suitable to race.  Bumped at the start.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between DAN ATTACK and TALENTS SUPREMO.  Near the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between DAN ATTACK and TALENTS SUPREMO (C L Chau) which shifted out to improve.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.  Near the 200 Metres made slight contact with WISEMAN when being shifted to the outside of YOUTH POWER to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Approaching the 100 Metres was held up behind YOUTH POWER when that runner commenced to give ground.  After shifting to the outside of YOUTH POWER near the 50 Metres QUANTUM PATCH was unable to be ridden out to the finish when positioned tight to the inside of VIVA GRACIOUSNESS which shifted in slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 3 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres.

Approaching the winning post was bumped by QUANTUM PATCH when that runner was racing tight to the inside of VIVA GRACIOUSNESS. Apprentice E C W Wong was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 3 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between QUANTUM PATCH and SUPER UNICORN which shifted out and away from WISEMAN.  Near the 100 Metres shifted out and away from FIREFOOT and made contact with CHAIN OF GOLD.
No report.
Bumped near the 100 Metres. K C Leung was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres.
Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

In the middle stages raced ungenerously.  Approaching the 300 Metres endeavoured to obtain a narrow run between NORTHERN BEAST and FIREFOOT, resulting in SUPER UNICORN making contact with FIREFOOT.  When unable to secure this run SUPER UNICORN was held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres.  Over the final 100 Metres SUPER UNICORN then could not be fully tested when again held up between NORTHERN BEAST and FIREFOOT.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On entering the Home Straight changed stride and as a result blundered and became unbalanced.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start was bumped by VIVA GRACIOUSNESS which shifted out.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After the event K Teetan stated that after settling back in the field his mount failed to respond to his riding and did not run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found it to be lame in its right front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, AMAZING RUN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped near the 300 Metres when it shifted out to improve.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with LUCKY PLANET, resulting in REGAL GEM becoming unbalanced.  A short distance later REGAL GEM was steadied to avoid GIANT LEAP (R Kingscote).  R Kingscote was reprimanded.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped by STORMING DRAGON when that runner shifted to the outside of THRIVING BROTHERS to improve.  Sent for sampling post-race.
For a short distance approaching the 400 Metres raced tight to the inside of STORMING DRAGON.

Crowded shortly after the start by POWER KOEPP which shifted out.  Approaching the 1100 Metres was contacted on the hindquarters by LUCKY PLANET which was racing tight to the inside of GIANT LEAP, resulting in THRIVING BROTHERS becoming unbalanced.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Crowded shortly after the start.  Approaching the 1100 Metres shifted in and away from GIANT LEAP, made contact with THRIVING BROTHERS and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event. M F Poon was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.

Leaving the 1000 Metres MONARCH COUNTY, which was racing keenly, was steadied to avoid GIANT LEAP (R Kingscote) which shifted in when not clear.  R Kingscote was severely reprimanded.  Over-raced throughout the early and middle stages and in the Back Straight was steadied to avoid DRAGON FOUR SEAS.  Badly held up between the 350 Metres and the 100 Metres.  Jockey A Atzeni was fined the sum of $5,000 for weighing in 2 lbs overweight on return to scale.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres.

Over the final 350 Metres was badly held up and as a consequence could not be tested in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 150 Metres, when giving ground, became unbalanced when positioned tight to the inside of SOVEREIGN FUND when that runner was badly held up for clear running.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 200 Metres.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up between the 500 Metres and the 250 Metres when it was shifted to the outside of BRAVE OF FRIENDS to obtain clear running.
No report.
Near the 1100 Metres was steadied to avoid THE WAY WE WIN when being shifted behind that runner for cover.

In the Home Straight lay in under pressure.  After the event H Bentley confirmed that his instructions were to go forward.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Near the 300 Metres raced in restricted room for a short distance between MANYTHANKS FOREVER and MY FLYING ANGEL which shifted out to improve.
No report.

Bumped at the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid ISLAND GOLDEN.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running behind EURO ROCKS.  After the 300 Metres NIGHT PUROSANGUE obtained a narrow run between EURO ROCKS and ISLAND GOLDEN, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to ease his mount near the 250 Metres before securing clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the event C Y Ho stated that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst horses and making the turn near the 800 Metres became awkward when racing tight to the inside of MANYTHANKS FOREVER.  He added that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount raced in a disappointing manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Shortly after the start made heavy contact with WATCH THIS ONE, resulting in OWNERS’ SUNSHINE becoming unbalanced, shifting in and making heavy contact with SUPERB GUY.  Jockey K De Melo was fined the sum of $5,000 for weighing in 1 lb overweight on return to scale.
Jumped awkwardly.
Bumped at the start.
K C Leung stated that over the final 300 Metres his mount hung in and proved difficult to ride.  Jockey Leung was warned in relation to using his whip on a horse that was out of contention.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the early stages.
Leaving the 900 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from SPIRIT OF PEACE.
Jumped only fairly and blundered shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Bumped at the start.  After the event Z Purton stated that his mount may not have run out a strong 1400 Metres racing first up today.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Slow to begin. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 300 Metres.
No report.
Had some difficulty obtaining clear running approaching the 300 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres was held up behind ARIEL for a short distance before shifting to that runner’s outside.

Jumped awkwardly and was bumped by BEAUTY CRESCENT, resulting in ANODE then shifting out and becoming unbalanced when it bumped PATCH OF STARS.  After the event R Kingscote advised that from a wide barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
On jumping was bumped by THE AUSPICIOUS which shifted out.  For some distance approaching the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind SOARING BRONCO which was commencing to give ground.

When questioned H Bentley stated that he was given no specific instructions where to settle and although his mount commenced well it did not respond to his efforts to hold a more forward position, which resulted in PRINCE ALEX settling at the rear of the field.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and if there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of SETANTA, H Bentley stated that although he was aware there was an opportunity to shift to that runner’s outside he was reluctant to do so as PRINCE ALEX was not travelling well enough to make a run around the field.  He said as a consequence he elected to improve to the inside of SETANTA with a view to following TO INFINITY.  He said when TAKE ACTION shifted away from the rail he was unable to continue to improve into that run which resulted in PRINCE ALEX having some difficulty obtaining clear running in the early stages of the Home Straight.  He added that he was able to shift to the outside of SETANTA near the 200 Metres where his mount finished the race off reasonably well.

After the event M L Yeung stated that his mount was unable to improve making the Home Turn when positioned behind SHANGHAI STYLE.  He said in the Home Straight CELESTIAL HARMONY responded fairly to his riding.  Noted to have lost its left hind plate after the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping and as a result became unbalanced.  After the event Y L Chung stated that he was instructed to lead on the horse and he was required to make some use of his mount in the early stages to do so, which resulted in the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time.  He added his mount was also disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead by SHANGHAI STYLE and as a consequence GOOD LUCK BABE gave ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn and the reason he shifted to the inside of RAGING RAPIDS to continue into clear running, K De Melo stated that when positioned close to RAGING RAPIDS he felt that near the 550 Metres he would have had to steady his mount in an attempt to come to that runner’s outside.  He said with BIG STRIDE being positioned directly to his outside and WINNING MACHINE racing in advance of that runner he felt his better option was to continue to the inside where he was able to follow the fancied runners ROMAN CROWN and BETTER AND BETTER into the race.  He added that after improving to the inside of RAGING RAPIDS, TOP TIME then became held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and after the 100 Metres where it then finished the race off strongly.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey De Melo in the circumstances were reasonable.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  Held up between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Over the concluding stages made contact with BETTER AND BETTER due to both runners shifting ground.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Over the concluding stages made contact with ROMAN CROWN due to both runners shifting ground.  Approaching the finish BETTER AND BETTER then raced in restricted room between TOP TIME and ROMAN CROWN which shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

On jumping was bumped by ROMAN CROWN which shifted in.  Briefly held up near the 300 Metres.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of J Orman, 7th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race. J Orman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 250 Metres.
Bumped shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Bumped shortly after the start.  After the event H T Mo advised that he was instructed to go forward.  He said DEAL COMPLETED failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and weakened.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of DEAL COMPLETED, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DEAL COMPLETED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped awkwardly.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of BILLION TWO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BILLION TWO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres where it secured a narrow run between RUN RUN SMART and DENFIELD.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. B Avdulla was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.

After the event Y L Chung stated that the intention was to be in a forward position and lead if circumstances permitted.  He said his mount jumped only fairly and shortly after the start raced in restricted room between GLORY B and METAL KING which was taken in by LUCKY SAM GOR, which resulted in it settling further back than intended.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 100 Metres was accidentally struck across the nose by the whip of A Badel, the rider of RUN RUN SMART, when racing tight to the inside of that runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was crowded by LUCKY SAM GOR which shifted in slightly.  Near the 1100 Metres was again steadied when crowded between LUCKY SAM GOR and VIGOR ELLEEGANT which was taken out by GREAT SPIRIT when that runner shifted out and away from MOTOMAN.  Leaving the 300 Metres shifted to the inside of MOTOMAN to continue into clear running.  METAL KING was then briefly held up behind GLORY B approaching the 200 Metres before obtaining clear running to that horse’s inside.

After the event L Hewitson stated that whilst it was not his intention to lead, GLORY B commenced well and he was able to hold the lead without having to apply too much pressure to do so.  He added that he was able to set a moderate tempo outside of standard time during the middle stages but on straightening his mount failed to respond to his riding and was disappointing.  Trainer D J Whyte stated that the preference was to ride the horse with cover having regard to its weight of 133 lbs.  He said nevertheless he was still disappointed with the horse’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GLORY B, a last start winner, was considered disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORY B will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
No report.

Became fractious after being loaded and got its left front leg over the starting gate partition for a considerable period of time.  Acting on veterinary advice that CHARMING BABE was not suitable to race the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, CHARMING BABE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shortly after the start was hampered when taken wider by DAILY TROPHY which shifted out.  Leaving the 1000 Metres shifted out and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Leaving the 1000 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded between BLAZING WIND and BEAUTY FORMULA which lay out before being corrected by its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lunged forward as the start was effected.
Bumped at the start.  Hampered near the 100 Metres when JOLLY COMPANION shifted out.

Jumped awkwardly, became unbalanced, shifted out, made contact with GIMME FIVE and lost ground.  Approaching the 100 Metres shifted out, resulting in its rider Apprentice P N Wong having to stop riding and straighten.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped only fairly and then was steadied when crowded between GIMME FIVE and MEEPMEEP.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Crowded at the start.  Leaving the 1000 Metres was bumped and taken wider by BLAZING WIND which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
J Orman was reprimanded in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle in a forehand manner on one occasion near the 150 Metres.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY FORMULA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lunged forward as the start was effected.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Had its right front plate refitted in the saddling stalls.  Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
Bumped shortly after the start.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  Noted to have bled from both nostrils after the race.  As this was the second occasion that EVERYONE’S CLASSIC had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
Bumped shortly after the start.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

On jumping was bumped by MR GOOD VIBES which shifted out, resulting in VERBIER then shifting out and making contact with STRONGEST BOY.  After the event Apprentice E C W Wong stated that he was obliged to make some use of his mount in the early stages to obtain a position outside the lead.  He said VERBIER raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, JUMBO FORTUNE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Leaving the 200 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of GOOD FORTUNE to continue into clear running.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.
After travelling a short distance was bumped by CLUB ACE.  Raced wide and without cover until near the 600 Metres.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.

After the event L Ferraris stated that his mount settled further back in the field when it bounded on jumping, shifted in, made contact with LEGEND STAR and lost ground.  He added that in the Home Straight PATCH OF TIME finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the Home Straight hung in and proved difficult to ride out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After travelling a short distance shifted in, made contact with GOOD FORTUNE and then was shifted behind that runner.  After the event M L Yeung stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but his mount failed to show sufficient pace in the early stages to do so.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up when being shifted to the outside of WIN METHOD to obtain clear running.  A Badel was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on two occasions near the 150 Metres.  After the event A Badel stated that from the outside barrier he was asked to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages to offset the outside draw.  He added that SAME TO YOU settled further back in the field than what he had expected.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued to Jockey Badel.  When questioned regarding the improved performance Mr Newnham stated that the horse had surprised him today that it was able to win the event.  He said he had not altered any of his training methods with the horse as compared to last season.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
J Orman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.

Crowded on jumping and became unbalanced.  After the 400 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running and made contact with LUCKY MCQUEEN on several occasions when it was being shifted out to improve into a tight run between LUCKY MCQUEEN and BUNTA BABY.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  K Teetan was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on a number of occasions approaching the 100 Metres.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight A Atzeni stated that after settling back in the field, soon after entering the Home Straight he improved to the outside of LEGENDARY IMPACT to obtain clear running and followed the favourite GROOVY FEELING into the event.  He said near the 300 Metres GROOVY FEELING did not improve as he had expected which resulted in SUNNY Q being held up behind GROOVY FEELING for a short distance before shifting to that runner’s inside to secure a clear run.  He added that approaching the 200 Metres he elected to endeavour to improve between BUNTA BABY and GROOVY FEELING as he was of the opinion that GROOVY FEELING was not finishing the race off and he would be able to improve to the inside of that horse.  He added that when GROOVY FEELING unexpectedly maintained this position and BUNTA BABY then shifted out under pressure he was obliged to check his mount when disappointed for clear running between those two horses.  He said a short distance later he was able to shift to the inside of BUNTA BABY where he secured clear running near the 100 Metres and his mount finished the race off strongly.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Atzeni were reasonable in the circumstances.
No report.

Over the concluding stages was steadied to avoid KING ALLOY (R Kingscote) which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.  R Kingscote was advised to exercise more care and in similar circumstances to react sooner than what he did on this occasion.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Between the 350 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.  After being briefly ridden along after leaving 150 Metres was again held up over the final 100 Metres behind SEA EMERALD and as a consequence could not be ridden out to the finish of the race.
Noted to have sustained a laceration to the left stifle after the race.

Crowded shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  After the event M Chadwick reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily until the Home Turn at which point he received contact from GROOVY FEELING to his inside when that runner was being shifted out.  He added that after this contact LUCKY MCQUEEN did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start became badly unbalanced when crowded between ARGENTO OCEAN and LUCKY MCQUEEN which shifted out and away from GROOVY FEELING after being bumped by GROOVY FEELING.  Near the 900 Metres was briefly crowded by SEA EMERALD which shifted in and away from ARGENTO OCEAN when racing tight to the inside of that runner.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped at the start.  After the event C L Chau stated that his mount commenced well and was able to hold an on-pace position.  He said GO GENERAL hung in throughout the event and proved difficult to ride.  He added that when he was concerned there may be something amiss with its action in the Home Straight he did not ride it out to the finish when not in a competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GO GENERAL, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GO GENERAL will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly when positioned outside the lead in the early and middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event D Probert advised that he was given no specific instructions but when his mount commenced well he elected to hold an on-pace position.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued and stated that with the hood being removed for today’s race the horse may have shown better gate speed as a consequence.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 1000 Metres was steadied away from the heels of CELTIC TIMES.  For some distance after the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when unable to improve between NO OTHER CHOICE and FANTASTIC FUN which resulted in POSITIVE SMILE being shifted to the inside of NO OTHER CHOICE to secure clear running.

After the event L Hewitson stated that his mount jumped awkwardly and as a consequence settled further back in the field than what he had intended.  He added that approaching the 400 Metres his mount was steadied to avoid RAGGA BOMB when that runner was taken wider by FANTASTIC FUN.  He said in this incident STRATHPEFFER lay in and as a result contributed to the incident. L Hewitson was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

When questioned M Chadwick stated that the instructions were to hold a midfield position but it was important that he obtained cover.  He said shortly after the start when positioned to the outside and in advance of STRATHPEFFER, he was of the opinion that runner would continue to obtain a more forward position.  He said when STRATHPEFFER did not continue forward he was concerned that he would be obliged to race wide and without cover and for this reason he elected to ease his mount to follow STRATHPEFFER to avoid covering additional ground.  He added that as a consequence of this FORERUNNER raced further back in the field than what he had been instructed.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.  Briefly held up near the 400 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event H Bentley stated that his mount was able to lead comfortably but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was most disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped. Trainer W Y So stated that the horse had pleased him leading into the race although, in his opinion, its barrier trial on 2 September 2025 was slightly below expectation.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of LIGHTNESS OF MUSIC, a last start winner, was considered disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, LIGHTNESS OF MUSIC will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. He said after this incident MAJESTIC EXPRESS did not fully stretch out and when not in a competitive position he did not continue to ride it out to the finish of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, MAJESTIC EXPRESS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

As the start was effected lunged forward which required the starting gate handler to provide assistance.  As a consequence MUST GO was slow to begin.

Jumped only fairly. Near the 900 Metres got its head up when racing keenly.  After the event M F Poon reported that his mount raced too keenly in the early and middle stages and as a consequence got its head up near the 900 Metres.  He added that having regard to the manner in which the horse raced it was unable to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 1100 Metres was checked to avoid CHAMPION METHOD (D Probert) which shifted in.  D Probert was severely reprimanded.  Whilst the Stewards acknowledged that he had made an effort to correct his mount he was advised in the circumstances he should have reacted sooner than what he did on this occasion.  When questioned K C Leung stated that the intention was to lead the event.  He said when his mount began only fairly and then was checked near the 1100 Metres this resulted in GOLDEN LUCK settling further back than intended where it obtained a midfield position with cover behind CHAMPION METHOD.  He added in the middle stages CHAMPION METHOD did not improve into the event which resulted in him having to make a run to that horse’s outside making the Home Turn.  He said he was then taken wider making the Home Turn which resulted in GOLDEN LUCK not being able to run on when he placed it under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, CHAMPION METHOD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Near the 50 Metres was steadied and shifted to the outside of the riderless SPICY SO SMART when that horse shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 250 Metres bounded over a section of the track.  For some distance after the 200 Metres was hampered when racing in restricted room between SILVER SPURS which shifted out slightly and the riderless SPICY SO SMART which shifted in.  Trainer K H Ting was fined $3,000 for presenting GOLDEN FRIENDSHIP in the Parade Ring with a ring bit which was not part of that horse’s declared gear.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the middle stages and near the 550 Metres was eased to avoid SILVER SPURS.
On jumping shifted in and made contact with TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR.

Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, TRIUMPHANT WARRIOR will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres was briefly crowded by WISDOM STAR which shifted in before being corrected by its rider K C Leung.  Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Over the concluding stages was eased when it shifted out towards NOBLE DELUXE when that runner shifted in slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
K C Leung was reprimanded in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 200 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Made contact with the right side of the starting gate on jumping.  Leaving the 600 Metres raced tight to the inside of MODEST GENTLEMAN.

Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration as to whether the horse had been afforded a fair start.  After taking evidence from Jockey M Chadwick and Starter A Speechley the Stewards found that the horse lowered its head simultaneously to the start being effected, resulting in M Chadwick being dislodged and the horse completing the race riderless and as a consequence it was declared a runner.  Trainer W K Mo was advised that the horse will be required to barrier trial satisfactorily prior to being permitted to race again.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On arrival at the Start HAPPY HORSE was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be lame in its right front leg.  Acting on veterinary advice that HAPPY HORSE was not suitable to race the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY HORSE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Slow to begin.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  J Orman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then raced in restricted room between FIREFOOT and DILBAGH which shifted out slightly.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn. M F Poon was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Between the 150 Metres and the 50 Metres raced tight between PRINCE ALEX and SUPREME AGILITY which shifted in slightly and as a result made contact with PRINCE ALEX.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned L Ferraris stated that leaving the 250 Metres he attempted to improve into a narrow run between ROMANTIC FANTASY and DILBAGH where there was not quite sufficient room.  He said as a result PRINCE ALEX raced in restricted room between those two runners between the 250 Metres and the 50 Metres where he was obliged to steady his mount when ROMANTIC FANTASY was taken in slightly by SUPREME AGILITY and DILBAGH shifted out slightly.  As the Stewards were satisfied that PRINCE ALEX had not clearly established running in this incident no action was taken.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. Near the 100 Metres PERFECT PAIRING was then shifted to the outside of SAMARKAND to continue into clear running.
No report.

After the event M L Yeung stated that his mount travelled well in the lead before giving ground in the Home Straight.  He added that, the horse, which was racing first up tonight, would derive a fitness benefit from tonight’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages in an on-paced position.  He added that under pressure in the Home Straight his mount did not respond to his riding and gave ground.  He said, in his opinion, the horse, which was racing first up over 1800 Metres, would derive a fitness benefit from tonight’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Approaching the 400 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the outside of MULTIDUTCH.  Approaching the 300 Metres was then disappointed for clear running between MEGA BONUS and NEW POWER which shifted out to improve.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Apprentice E C W Wong (MEGA BONUS) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 550 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of HONEST WITNESS, resulting in HONEST WITNESS losing its rightful running and being checked and then being taken in onto MASTER CHAMPION which was crowded for room.  Apprentice Wong was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Wednesday, 24 September 2025 and to expire on Monday, 29 September 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In addition, Apprentice Wong was fined $20,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He said MEGA BONUS came under pressure leaving the 600 Metres and when he was concerned that there was something amiss with the horse in the Home Straight he eased it down from the event. The performance of WOODFIRE BRO, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, WOODFIRE BRO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <18/9/2025 Additional Veterinary Report>WOODFIRE BRO, which was retired from the event leaving the 600 Metres, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. WOODFIRE BRO was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer C W Chang this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its left hind leg. As previously advised, WOODFIRE BRO will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

He added that STORM RUNNER continued to respond to his urgings to the finish of the event and, in his opinion, is looking for additional distance in its races. Near the 900 Metres, PERIDOT, which was racing keenly, got its head up when being steadied to avoid FLASH STAR (R Kingscote) which shifted in when not clear.  As a result PERIDOT then shifted out, resulting in ELEGANT LIFE, which was following, having to steady to avoid PERIDOT and ELEGANT LIFE then shifting out.  As a result BASIC INSTINCT was crowded and NOBLE FANS steadied when EMBLAZON (C L Chau) shifted in.  R Kingscote was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  C L Chau was reprimanded for shifting in and contributing to the interference to NOBLE FANS and BASIC INSTINCT.  After the event Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid PERIDOT.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight L Hewitson stated that after following PERIDOT he initially contemplated improving between PERIDOT and FLASH STAR leaving the 400 Metres.  He added that when he was not comfortable there was sufficient room to improve between those two runners he shifted out to follow PERIDOT as he felt that runner, which was a favourite in the event, would provide him with the opportunity to follow it into the race.  He said when PERIDOT did not improve as he had expected and AWESOME TREASURE maintained its position to that runner’s outside this resulted in ELEGANT LIFE being badly held up for clear running over the final 400 Metres and not being able to be ridden out to the finish.  Having considered Jockey Hewitson’s explanation and whilst he agreed that a run had developed between FLASH STAR and PERIDOT, the Stewards found that the explanation provided was reasonable in the circumstances.

Between the 150 Metres and the 50 Metres was held up for clear running behind PERIDOT.  After being shifted to the inside of PERIDOT near the 50 Metres then could not be fully ridden out when it raced tight to the inside of that runner.  After the event C Y Ho reported that his mount jumped only fairly and did not show sufficient pace in the early stages to hold a more forward position.

On jumping made contact with the left side of its starting gate and lost ground. The performance of KINGDOM OF RICHES, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KINGDOM OF RICHES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. K Teetan pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 800 Metres (see DOUBLE BINGO).  Sent for sampling post-race.

K Teetan (SPEEDY SMARTIE) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 800 Metres he directed his mount out across the heels of NOTTHESILLYONE, resulting in BRILLIANT FIRE being hampered and taken wider and causing DOUBLE BINGO to be checked.  K Teetan was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 12 October 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  Lay out on the Home Turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start made contact with FALCON COURT due to both runners shifting ground.  A short distance later LEGEND STAR then became unbalanced when crowded between FALCON COURT and EURO ROCKS which shifted in slightly.  Between the 300 Metres and the 100 Metres was badly held up for clear running behind CHEER FOR SOUTH.

After the event A Atzeni reported that his mount, which was racing first up today, finished the race off satisfactorily and, in his opinion, would derive a fitness benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

At declaration time, A Atzeni was declared as the rider of both SUNNY DARLING and CHEER FOR SOUTH.  It was established that A Atzeni had been inadvertently declared as the rider of SUNNY DARLING when in fact B Avdulla had been engaged to ride that horse.  For this declaration error, Trainer P C Ng was fined $2,000.  After the event B Avdulla stated that his mount did not show sufficient pace to cross runners in the early stages and as a consequence raced wide and without cover for the majority of the race before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have blood at the right nostril.  An endoscopic examination conducted on SUNNY DARLING found that there was no blood in its trachea and therefore the blood in the nostril was determined to be not coming from the lungs and as such the horse was deemed not to have bled.
No report.

Shortly after the start made contact with LEGEND STAR due to both runners shifting ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Near the 800 Metres was hampered when taken wider.  After the event H Bowman stated that his mount gave ground in the Home Straight, particularly over the final 200 Metres and he felt that the horse may have been galloped on during the running of the race by another runner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shortly after the start was bumped.  When giving ground approaching the 50 Metres was steadied when crowded between CARROLL STREET and LITTLE MONSTER (C L Chau) which shifted to the inside of ENJOY GOLF to obtain clear running.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.  After the event L Ferraris reported that his mount was able to obtain an on-pace position but gave ground from the 150 Metres when placed under pressure.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between WATCH THIS ONE and ENJOY GOLF which shifted in and away from TOP THRONE despite the efforts of its rider.
Near the 250 Metres was eased to avoid LITTLE MONSTER (C L Chau) which shifted out to improve.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  After the event L Ferraris stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position if possible, but after jumping awkwardly his mount settled back in the field.  Trainer M Newnham confirmed the instructions issued.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
No report.
Near the 700 Metres became unbalanced when it lay out and away from HAPPY ACTION.  Lay in over the concluding stages.
No report.
Near the 250 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between CALIFORNIA BANNER and CALIFORNIA BAY which shifted out slightly.

Shifted out abruptly at the start and was bumped.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

C L Chau was fined the sum of $10,000 for breaching Rule 100(3)(ii)(f) in that he used his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on a number of occasions over the final 150 Metres.  In assessing penalty the Stewards considered that Jockey Chau had been issued with a number of warnings during this racing season.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Between the 75 Metres and the concluding stages was held up behind BLAZING WUKONG.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Leaving the 100 Metres was steadied to avoid LUCKY SAM GOR (C L Chau) which shifted in.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care.

In the early stages raced keenly when being shifted behind runners to obtain cover.  SIGHT DREAMER then continued to race keenly throughout the middle stages and near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid JOYFUL TREASURE.

Shortly after the start was eased when momentarily crowded by SIGHT DREAMER which shifted in slightly.  Approaching the 700 Metres was bumped by VIVACIOUS WIN which was racing tight to the inside of GOOD LUCK WIN.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its starting gate and then shortly after the start made contact with CONSPIRACY WITNESS.  Near the 1200 Metres was steadied when crowded by CONSPIRACY WITNESS which was racing tight to the inside of BLAZING WUKONG (A Atzeni) which shifted in slightly.  A Atzeni was reprimanded.

Sent for sampling post-race.
After the event L Hewitson reported that his mount lay out making the Home Turn.

On jumping was checked when crowded between GOOD LUCK BABE and DAILY TROPHY which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider L Hewitson.

Had its left front plate refitted in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly and then was steadied when crowded between FORTUNE WARRIOR and GOOD LUCK BABE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a small abrasion to the right hind pastern.

Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions and said he issued these instructions as DRACO had finished the race off only fairly at its most recent start when ridden in a forward position and also to offset the wide barrier draw.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1100 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from APOLAR FIGHTER.

The performance of BINGO BABE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, BINGO BABE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped approaching the 700 Metres when racing tight.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when crowded between LUCKY SAM GOR and TIME TO FIRE which shifted out slightly.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres VIVACIOUS WIN was then held up behind JOLLY JUMPER when that runner was giving ground.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping made contact with the right side of its starting gate and then shortly after the start blundered and became unbalanced.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 450 Metres and the 250 Metres.  Over the concluding stages lay in resulting in its rider M F Poon changing his whip through to his right hand.  Sent for sampling post-race.

After the event H Bowman stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and this was the reason that it was unable to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He added that his mount performs best when able to dictate in front.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be displaying an airway abnormality pending further assessment.  <12/11/2025 28 September 2025 Sha Tin Racemeeting – Race 9 (53)> A further assessment of the respiratory condition did not reveal any significant findings.

He added that when caught wide he was then obliged to come back to find a position with cover.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, FAIRY HORSE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After being placed in the starting gates reared and got both front legs over the front gates. The Stewards ruled that IRON LEGION will be required to attend barrier practice to the satisfaction of the Starter prior to performing satisfactorily in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.

Near the 900 Metres, when racing greenly, was steadied when placed in restricted room to the inside of STAR PERFORMER (D Probert) which shifted in.  D Probert was advised to exercise more care.

Jumped awkwardly.  Lay in over the concluding stages.  When questioned regarding the horse racing in a more forward position today, D Probert stated that from the outside barrier with his mount stepping up in distance he was given the option of holding a more forward position.  He said when STAR PERFORMER jumped well he elected to continue forward and hold an on-pace position to take advantage of the good start.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after the start was crowded between MASTER PHOENIX and SEA EMERALD.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid GASTRONOMIQUE. After the event M Chadwick reported that the intention was to hold a more forward position.  He said when his mount did not show sufficient pace to do so this resulted in HANDSOME BOMB being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added as a consequence of the wide run HANDSOME BOMB was unable to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping was crowded by SKY SONG which shifted out abruptly, resulting in SEA EMERALD blundering.  When questioned J Orman stated that his mount was crowded at the start and as a result settled back.  He said SEA EMERALD travelled satisfactorily throughout the early and middle stages but when asked for an effort in the Home Straight he became concerned with its action which resulted in him easing the horse out of the event near the 300 Metres.  He added that he had ridden the horse at its previous race starts and it did not display any lameness issues during the running of those races.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right hind leg.  Before being allowed to race again, SEA EMERALD will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned Z Purton stated that in the early stages he endeavoured to obtain a position with cover behind DRAGON JOY.  He said when the pace of the event eased leaving the 1100 Metres he was unable to obtain cover and when SOUTH STAR then commenced to race keenly he allowed it to stride forward and race outside the leader BEAUTY CRESCENT.  Noted to have lost its right hind plate and sustained minor abrasions to the right hind leg after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 30.9.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen left front fetlock) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter THE CONCENTRATION.  Before being allowed to race again, SUNNY DARLING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
