Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when held up behind RAGING RAPIDS and STRANGE ALERT.  When questioned regarding his riding K Teetan stated that after the 700 Metres his mount raced keenly when positioned close to NO OTHER CHOICE and when NO OTHER CHOICE was racing ungenerously his focus was on avoiding that runner.  He added that when GALE SAGA improved quickly to his outside near the 650 Metres he was then unable to shift out and as a consequence was steadied and made contact with GALE SAGA, which resulted in SUNDAY’S SERENADE being held up for clear running making the Home Turn.  He said after being held up in the early stages of the Home Straight he endeavoured to improve between GALE SAGA and NO OTHER CHOICE which was giving ground, where in the opinion of the Stewards, there was not sufficient room to do so.  A short distance later NO OTHER CHOICE shifted out near the 250 Metres, resulting in SUNDAY’S SERENADE having to be checked when disappointed for this run.  K Teetan was advised to exercise more care and to ensure he has sufficient room where he is endeavouring to improve.

Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded by GALE SAGA (A Badel) which shifted in.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running behind SUNDAY’S SERENADE.  After shifting to the outside of SUNDAY’S SERENADE, RAINBOW SEVEN was again held up for clear running for a short distance near the 300 Metres.  Near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when endeavouring to improve between RAGING RAPIDS and STRANGE ALERT.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.
Near the 200 Metres blundered.  For a short distance after the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running between MAGIC CONTROL and WUNDERBAR.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was bumped by WUNDERBAR.  For some distance after the 500 Metres endeavoured to obtain a run between WUNDERBAR and BABY CRYSTAL when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in MAGIC CONTROL making contact with WUNDERBAR. C Y Ho was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides inside the 200 Metres.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with BOTTOMUPTOGETHER.  Leaving the 500 Metres MAGIC CONTROL (C Y Ho) endeavoured to improve into a run between BABY CRYSTAL and WUNDERBAR where, in the opinion of the Stewards, there was not sufficient room to do so.  A short distance later BABY CRYSTAL then shifted out, resulting in MAGIC CONTROL and WUNDERBAR making contact and both runners becoming unbalanced.  C Y Ho was reprimanded and advised that he must ensure when improving into runs there is sufficient room to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when positioned behind WUNDERBAR.

Approaching the 200 Metres became unbalanced when it made contact with FAST NETWORK due to both runners shifting ground.  After the event Z Purton stated that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race and did not respond to his riding over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  After the event M F Poon stated that with WUNDERBAR positioned to his inside his mount did not relax during the running of the race and failed to respond to his riding over the final 200 Metres.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to have sustained a small abrasion to the right hind leg.  Before being allowed to race again, BOTTOMUPTOGETHER will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Leaving the 500 Metres shifted out and was corrected by its rider Apprentice E C W Wong.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start bumped with HONG LOK GOLF.  After being crossed by TOURBILLON PRINCE near the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid TOURBILLON PRINCE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shortly after the start was crowded between STEPS AHEAD and HEALTHY HAPPY which shifted in whilst being corrected by its rider.  Near the 650 Metres was steadied when unable to improve between STEPS AHEAD and HUGE WAVE which was improving around the field.
No report.

A Badel was fined the sum of $5,000 for breaching Rule 100(3)(ii)(f) in that he used his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on two occasions in the Home Straight.  When questioned regarding his riding in the middle stages and the reason he made a forward move A Badel stated that after settling back in the field, when he felt the pace of the race eased, he then elected to allow his mount to stride forward near the 800 Metres to ensure that it was able to make up ground in the Home Straight.  He added that after improving to the outside of STEPS AHEAD near the 650 Metres, that runner also commenced a forward move, resulting in HUGE WAVE being taken wider on the Home Turn but finished the race off reasonably well.  After considering the sectional times of the event which showed that between the 1200 Metres and the 800 Metres the race was run outside of standard time, the Stewards found the tactics adopted were reasonable in the circumstances.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be displaying an airway abnormality pending further assessment. <19/10/2025 1 October 2025 Sha Tin Racemeeting– Race 9 (64)> A further assessment of the airway abnormality did not reveal any significant findings.

After the event L Ferraris stated that from a wide barrier he was obliged to settle back in the field.  He added in the Home Straight CHINA WIN did not respond to his riding and, in his opinion, was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping.  For some distance after the 700 Metres raced ungenerously when positioned close to JUICY DRAGON.  After the event D Probert stated that his mount raced too keenly and did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 650 Metres became unbalanced when taken wider by RAGING RAPIDS which shifted out when being steadied to avoid SUNDAY’S SERENADE.
No report.
No report.

Approaching the 600 Metres commenced to race keenly and as a consequence was obliged to steady to avoid HONG LOK GOLF.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres and again near the 150 Metres (4 in total).
Jumped only fairly and then was inconvenienced by BRAVE OF FRIENDS which was taken in slightly by KA YING POWER.

Over the final 150 Metres lay out under pressure, resulting in its rider B Avdulla having to change his whip through to his left hand near the 50 Metres.  Over the concluding stages SILVERY BREEZE made contact with MAX QUE due to both runners shifting ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Made contact with the left side of its starting gate on jumping and as a consequence lost ground. Bumped on jumping.  After the event K C Leung stated that his mount, which was racing first up today, would derive a fitness benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He added that for him to carry out those instructions he ended up behind GO GO GO which was unable to continue with a forward position into the race and therefore he was obliged to settle further back in the field than he would have liked.

After the event Apprentice E C W Wong could offer no explanation for his mount’s performance other than it was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of SPORTIC WARRIOR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, SPORTIC WARRIOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. He added that, in his opinion, the horse did not feel comfortable in its action.  Trainer K L Man stated that SPANGLE FORTUNE had worked well leading up to the event and Jockey Purton reported to him that the horse resented the kickback on the All Weather surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, SPANGLE FORTUNE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

Before being allowed to race again, LUCKY GENERATIONS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding her riding tactics leaving the 700 Metres when commencing a run three wide at that point with the first section of the race being run inside standard Apprentice P N Wong conceded that in hindsight she had erred by commencing a run too soon and that she should have waited longer before sustaining a run so far from the finish.  The Stewards informed Apprentice Wong that she had erred on this occasion and should be mindful to ensure that her mounts are ridden in a manner that gain the best possible placing in the finish.  Sent for sampling post-race.

He added for this reason he was reluctant to put his mount under too much pressure in the early part of the Home Straight with a view to assisting it to finish the race off.  He said, in his opinion, FUN TOGETHER would derive benefit from its first up run today.

L Hewitson (METRO POWER) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that after passing the 500 Metres he permitted his mount to shift out leaving insufficient room for PACKING BOLE and FAST RESPONDER which were racing to his outside, resulting in FAST RESPONDER being checked and losing its rightful running.  L Hewitson was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Sunday, 26 October 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.

Following further assessment of the abnormal heart rate, the Stewards will consider if any further action is taken against the horse. <19/10/2025 4 October 2025 Sha Tin Racemeeting– Race 9 (74)> Confirmed on specialist advice to be displaying an irregular heart rhythm after the pre-race veterinary examination. Before being allowed to race again, BEAUTY INFINITY will now be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and also be subjected to an official veterinary examination as previously advised.

When questioned regarding the apparent improved performance Trainer P F Yiu stated that the horse has raced well previously first up from a spell and with the light weight today he advised the connections that he expected MIGHTY STRENGTH to run well.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned B Avdulla expressed satisfaction with the horse’s performance being first up from a spell.  He said ENTHRALLED wanted to lay in in the Home Straight which prevented him from riding his mount out with the whip.  He added that over the concluding stages ENTHRALLED was slightly inconvenienced as a result of MONEY CATCHER shifting out towards his mount.
Shortly after the start made contact with BEAUTY THUNDER and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly when being crossed by SILVER SPURS.  K Teetan was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on two occasions near the 100 Metres.

In the early stages raced ungenerously when being shifted behind runners from a wide barrier.  Near the 1000 Metres became unbalanced when it shifted out and away from LOVING VIBES.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid DAN ATTACK which shifted out and away from LOVING VIBES. Near the 1100 Metres KNOW AT HEART became unbalanced when crowded between CALIFORNIA DEEPLY which lay in despite the efforts of its rider and MOTOMAN which shifted out slightly.

After the event J Orman stated that his mount did not appreciate carrying the top weight in tonight’s race but also did not fully stretch out on the "Good to Firm” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

In the early stages raced ungenerously and got its head up when obtaining a position with cover behind MIGHTY STEED.  After obtaining a position with cover behind MIGHTY STEED near the 1200 Metres SUPER SICARIO then raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages.  Lay in under pressure in the Home Straight and for a short distance near the 150 Metres was awkwardly placed close to the heels of MIGHTY STEED which shifted out slightly.
No report.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding C L Chau stated that from a wide barrier he had been instructed to endeavour to obtain a midfield position with cover.  He said with the early stages of the event being run inside of standard time FORERUNNER settled towards the back of the field.  When questioned regarding his riding on the Home Turn and as to whether there was an opportunity to improve to the outside of CELESTIAL PATCH sooner than what he did C L Chau stated that the instructions issued by Trainer W K Mo preferred the horse securing an inside run due to the rail being in the "C+3” position.  He said with this in mind, when following CELESTIAL PATCH, he was of the opinion that from the 500 Metres that horse would shift out as it was under pressure and being ridden along.  He added that when CELESTIAL PATCH did not shift out and SIMPLE HEDGE then moved out from the rail he was unable to secure an inside run into the Home Straight.  He said after remaining behind CELESTIAL PATCH he then shifted FORERUNNER to the outside on entering the Home Straight where it finished the race off reasonably well.  Mr Mo confirmed the instructions issued and expressed satisfaction with the manner in which Jockey Chau rode the horse.  After considering his explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Chau that, in their opinion, he should have shifted to the outside of CELESTIAL PATCH sooner than what he did, particularly having regard to the fact that his mount was positioned towards the rear of the field on the Home Turn.  He was further advised that in similar circumstances he should ride his mounts so as to leave no room for query.

Shortly after the start was crowded between SIMPLE HEDGE and ABSOLUTE HONOUR which shifted in slightly.  After the event D Probert stated that his mount did not appreciate the "Good to Firm” track conditions.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running behind TO INFINITY.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by CELESTIAL PATCH.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
After the event A Badel stated that his mount did not appreciate the "Good to Firm” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event Y L Chung stated that with his mount stepping up in distance from the 1200 Metres to the 1650 Metres it raced keenly in the lead and refused to settle in the early stages.  He added that as a consequence VIGOR ELLEEGANT ran inside of standard time in the early stages despite his efforts to set a more sustainable pace.  He said having regard to the manner in which the horse raced in the early stages it weakened when placed under pressure in the Home Straight. Y L Chung was reprimanded in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on two occasions near the 150 Metres. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.  The performance of VIGOR ELLEEGANT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, VIGOR ELLEEGANT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 500 Metres shifted out and made contact with YOUNG BRILLIANT.  Near the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving into a narrow run between CALL ME TOPSEED and VIVA GRACIOUSNESS.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event H Bowman stated that it was not the intention to hold a position outside the lead but after commencing well SUPER SIXTY showed good pace in the early stages where it was able to obtain a more forward position without being unduly pressured to do so.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY UNITED will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 6.10.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter AMAZING KID.  Before being allowed to race again, PLENTIFUL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.

K Teetan pleaded guilty to a charge under Rule 100(3(ii)(a) in that he used the whip in consecutive strides on at least 12 occasions prior to the 100 Metres.  After considering the relevant matters in respect of penalty which included the severity of the breach, a previous warning issued to Jockey Teetan regarding his whip hand being raised above shoulder height earlier during the meeting, the horse finishing in the first placing and also taking into consideration that the Rule was only introduced at the commencement of the season, he was issued with a two-meeting penalty.  As a consequence Jockey Teetan was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Thursday, 30 October 2025 and to expire on Monday, 3 November 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding C L Chau stated that his instructions from a wide barrier were to settle the horse where comfortable.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and without cover he elected to restrain his mount in the Back Straight to ensure that he complied with his instructions to obtain cover.  He added that this resulted in SUPER JOY N FUN being settled towards the rear of the field.  When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and in the early part of the Home Straight, particularly the vigour he used on SUPER JOY N FUN, C L Chau stated that after making the Home Turn he ensured his mount was balanced and encouraged SUPER JOY N FUN to change its lead leg.  He said when SUPER JOY N FUN did not change its lead leg in the early part of the Home Straight he continued to encourage the horse to improve but did not apply full vigour until near the 200 Metres after which SUPER JOY N FUN finished the race off reasonably well.  After considering the explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Chau that, in their opinion, he should have placed more pressure on his mount sooner than what he did to ensure that it obtained the best possible placing in the field.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding his riding making the Home Turn and in the early stages of the Home Straight A Badel stated that approaching the 500 Metres he received a call from Z Purton, rider of SUPER STRONG KID, when ALSONSO shifted in slightly.  He said as a consequence he looked to his inside and corrected his mount to avoid crowding the running of SUPER STRONG KID.  He added that when he placed ALSONSO under pressure entering the Home Straight it changed stride and lay out which resulted in a run presenting for SUPER STRONG KID to his inside.
No report.
Jumped only fairly.  In the Home Straight lay in under pressure.  Near the 50 Metres raced tight to the inside of POWER KOEPP which shifted in.
Bumped at the start.  In the middle stages raced keenly and approaching the 800 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from GOLDEN EMPIRE.
No report.

After the event A Atzeni stated that his mount was slow to begin but was able to show sufficient pace in the early stages to hold an on-pace position behind the favourite SUPER STRONG KID.  He added after initially responding to his riding in the early stages of the Home Straight YEE CHEONG GLORY was unable to finish the race off over the final 150 Metres where it gave ground over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
On jumping bumped with POWER KOEPP.  Approaching the 400 Metres made contact with TACTICAL COMMAND when being shifted out to improve.
Approaching the 400 Metres was bumped by NOVA KNIGHT.
Sent for sampling post-race.

A Badel was fined the sum of $5,000 for breaching Rule 100(3)(ii)(f) in that he used his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on two occasions over the concluding stages.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid COLOURFUL KNIGHT.  A short distance later TIN FOOK shifted out and made contact with THE RED HARE.  Held up making the Home Turn and in the early stages of the Home Straight.  M F Poon pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference over the concluding stages (see SUGAR BALL).
Made contact with the left side of its starting gate on jumping and lost ground.  SOLID WIN was then crowded between COLOURFUL KNIGHT and THE RED HARE.

Jumped awkwardly and then shortly after was crowded by SUGAR BALL which shifted out on jumping.  Bumped near the 700 Metres.  Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards gave consideration if there were grounds for a protest/objections on behalf of the 5th placegetter THE RED HARE which was taken wider by TIN FOOK over the concluding stages.  When the Stewards were satisfied there were not sufficient grounds to lodge a protest/objection and the connections chose not to, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  M F Poon (TIN FOOK) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that over the concluding stages he directed his mount to the outside of MASTER OF ALL where there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in TIN FOOK making contact with THE RED HARE and taking that horse across the running of SUGAR BALL which was checked.  M F Poon was suspended from riding in races for a period to commence on Sunday, 2 November 2025 and to expire on Thursday, 6 November 2025 on which day he may resume race riding (2 Hong Kong racedays).  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.  After the event K C Leung reported that he was unable to ride SUGAR BALL out to the finish of the race due to his mount receiving interference over the concluding stages.

In the middle stages raced keenly.  Approaching the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid IGOR STRAVINSKY.  Over the concluding stages was steadied to avoid THE RED HARE when that runner was taken out by TIN FOOK.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
D Probert was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 150 Metres.
Shortly after the start raced in restricted room between IGOR STRAVINSKY and JUNEAU PRIDE.
After the event M Chadwick could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 300 Metres was bumped by FATAL BLOW which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 700 Metres made contact with GUMMY GUMMY due to both runners shifting ground.
Bumped near the 300 Metres.
No report.
Near the 700 Metres made contact with GIANT LEAP due to both runners shifting ground.

Near the 750 Metres became unbalanced when crowded by NEW FOREST (L Hewitson) which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  L Hewitson was reprimanded and advised that he should have made an effort sooner to relieve the tightening to SOLID SHALAA.  In assessing the incident the Stewards also took into consideration that NEW FOREST shifted in and away from BLAZING WIND.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, SOLID SHALAA will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.

After the event H Bowman stated that after settling towards the back of the field he was unable to proceed forward between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres when held up behind SOLID SHALAA which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres lay in as it improved into a narrow run between BRAVE STAR and WONDER KIT.

Jumped only fairly.  In the early stages raced ungenerously when being shifted across behind runners to obtain cover.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between DANCING CODE and GORGEOUS WIN (H Bowman) which shifted out.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.

Crowded at the start.  After the event H Bowman stated that his mount responded only fairly to his riding in the Home Straight and shortened stride during the middle stages of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped on the hindquarters.  After the event L Hewitson stated that his mount came under pressure at the 500 Metres and did not finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Trainer M Newnham confirmed that he had instructed L Hewitson to ride the horse with cover today.  Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Briefly held up near the 300 Metres.  Near the 100 Metres improved into a narrow run to the inside of HAPPY UNIVERSE as that runner shifted in slightly.  As a result BULL ATTITUDE was momentarily crowded by HAPPY UNIVERSE, resulting in those two runners making contact.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 100 Metres shifted in and made contact with BULL ATTITUDE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when racing in restricted room between BEAUTY MISSILE and PEARL OF PANG’S which shifted out slightly.

Shortly after the start was bumped by PEARL OF PANG’S which shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

After the event H T Mo reported that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said when his mount commenced well he was able to race in the lead without being pressured to do so.  He added that once he obtained the lead his mount raced keenly and did not settle throughout the early and middle stages.
Shortly after the start was eased when crowded by BEAUTY MISSILE which shifted in slightly.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when positioned close to the heels of FIGHT TIME.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by BULL ATTITUDE which shifted in.
No report.

Approaching the 300 Metres was steadied when crowded between PRESTIGE RICKY (C L Chau) and BEAUTY MISSILE (A Badel), both of which shifted ground.  Both C L Chau and A Badel were advised to exercise more care.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

The performance of COLOURFUL KNIGHT, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, COLOURFUL KNIGHT will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping made contact with the left side of its starting gate and became unbalanced.  After the event C Y Ho reported that in this incident his left foot made contact with the starting gate partition.  Jockey Ho was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.  Held up for clear running making the Home Turn.

Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out to the finish when positioned close to the heels of REWARDING BUDDY.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  H Bowman was fined the sum of $5,000 for weighing in 2 lbs overweight on return to scale.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Noted to have blood at the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.
Jumped only fairly.  R Kingscote was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 200 Metres.

Approaching the 600 Metres was shifted to a position one-off to follow MANYTHANKS FOREVER.  Near the 500 Metres MANYTHANKS FOREVER then shifted out abruptly when being steadied to avoid LAPRAS which resulted in THE WAY WE WIN improving to the inside of MANYTHANKS FOREVER.  A short distance later THE WAY WE WIN struck the heels of MANYTHANKS FOREVER when that runner shifted back in to resume its position.  As the Stewards were satisfied that there was no rider error involved in the incident no action was taken.  After the event H Bentley stated that his mount settled further back in the field after being crowded at the start.  He said after THE WAY WE WIN lost ground when it blundered near the 600 Metres it did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Became fractious whilst being loaded at Sha Tin and sustained a small abrasion to the right knee.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race. He added at its last start at Happy Valley over the same distance the horse performed well and he attributed tonight’s improved performance to CELTIC TIMES appreciating racing at the Happy Valley circuit. Approaching the 200 Metres GLORIOUS JOURNEY then had difficulty obtaining clear running when held up behind METAL KING and was then shifted to the inside of METAL KING to obtain clear running.

After the event A Atzeni stated that he was able to obtain a position with cover in the early stages behind NO OTHER CHOICE with the pace of the event being run inside of standard time.  He said entering the Back Straight approaching the 900 Metres he felt the pace of the event eased and as his mount had a light weight he elected to shift out and ride forward to cross NO OTHER CHOICE.  He said when NO OTHER CHOICE then held its position to his inside for some distance he was obliged to make further use of HANDSOME BOMB to cross that runner.  He further stated that entering the Home Straight HANDSOME BOMB then finished the race off only fairly.  After considering his explanation and taking into account the sectional times of the event which confirmed his evidence that the pace between the 1200 Metres and the 800 Metres had eased, the tactics he adopted were found to be reasonable in the circumstances.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
Bumped shortly after the start and became unbalanced.  Near the 950 Metres was steadied to avoid HANDSOME BOMB when racing keenly.
After travelling a short distance was crowded for room between CELTIC TIMES and SAMARKAND which got its head up and shifted out.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, WITHOUT DELAY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

He added that as a result SMART CITY was obliged to race wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres. He said YOUTH POWER jumped only fairly and then he rode his mount along in the early stages to comply with his instructions.  He said when STAR GLOW improved to his outside he was content to allow that horse to cross his mount as he felt a position with cover would be advantageous.

He added that when placed under pressure LA FORZA did not respond to his riding and when he was concerned with the horse’s action he did not ride it out over the final 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  The performance of LA FORZA was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, LA FORZA will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Bumped at the start.  After the event C Y Ho stated that from a wide barrier he was given the option of taking up a forward position.  He said when STAR GLOW commenced well and the early stages of the event were run outside of standard time he elected to allow STAR GLOW to stride forward and race outside the lead in the early stages.  He added that STAR GLOW was unable to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained small lacerations to the left hind pastern and heel.  The performance of STAR GLOW, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, STAR GLOW will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  For a short distance near the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of TOURBILLON GOLFER.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Raced keenly approaching the first turn near the 1300 Metres.  After the event H Bentley stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and unable to find cover he elected to shift his mount in from a wide barrier to obtain cover which resulted in LO RIDER settling further back than intended.  He added that in the Home Straight LO RIDER finished the race off only fairly from back in the field.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the intention was to hold a more forward position.  He added in the early stages he was satisfied that Jockey Bentley had obtained a position back in the field as LO RIDER has a tendency to race keenly when ridden along in the early stages.  He said the only explanation he could offer was that LO RIDER was not suited by having to be ridden in this manner in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped at the start.  After the event H Bowman stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover but failed to respond to his riding from the 500 Metres.  He added when not in a competitive position in the Home Straight he eased his mount down from the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its left front leg.  The performance of CHILL CHIBI, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CHILL CHIBI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Leaving the 1600 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied to avoid CAMBRIDGE for some distance thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up approaching the 200 Metres.  Shifted out at the 200 Metres and made contact with THE PERFECT MATCH.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped shortly after the start.  The Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by C L Chau, rider of THE PERFECT MATCH, 3rd placegetter, against THUNDER PRINCE (H Bowman) being declared 2nd placegetter alleging interference near the 200 Metres.  After considering the evidence the Stewards found that after being held up for clear running behind KING GLORIOSO approaching the 200 Metres THUNDER PRINCE then shifted out and made contact with THE PERFECT MATCH, resulting in that horse being taken out slightly.  As the Stewards could not be comfortably satisfied that had that incident not occurred, THE PERFECT MATCH would have finished in advance of THUNDER PRINCE, the protest/objection was overruled and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  At a subsequent inquiry H Bowman was advised in similar circumstances he should exercise more care.  In assessing the incident the Stewards took into consideration that Jockey Bowman advised that he had anticipated KING GLORIOSO to continue to shift in which would have presented him with clear running.  When questioned regarding his riding between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres and as to whether there was an opportunity to ride his mount with more vigour C L Chau stated that he was asked to obtain a position where comfortable but did not place his mount under pressure too soon as THE PERFECT MATCH was found to have bled previously.  He said with these instructions in mind, after entering the Home Straight, whilst encouraging his horse to improve, he did not ride it with full vigour having regard to his instructions and also the fact that THE PERFECT MATCH lay in during that section of the race.  He added that when he reached the 200 Metres he then applied full vigour to his mount and THE PERFECT MATCH finished the race off well following contact with THUNDER PRINCE.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions and the reasons as to why such instructions were issued and expressed satisfaction with Jockey Chau’s riding.  Having considered the evidence the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Chau were reasonable in the circumstances.  After the race, an endoscopic examination was conducted on THE PERFECT MATCH at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, THE PERFECT MATCH will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

C Y Ho reported that the instructions were to endeavour to hold a midfield position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to shift his mount behind runners to take up a position towards the rear of the field to avoid racing wide.

He said from the 700 Metres his mount came under pressure before giving ground in the Home Straight but he could offer no reason for its disappointing performance. Withdrawn on 18.10.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter KING ALLOY. M L Yeung stated that the only explanation he could offer for his mount’s disappointing performance was the fact that it was left racing without cover today and when it won its previous race start on 28 September 2025 it finished the race off well when it obtained cover.  Trainer K H Ting concurred with the views expressed by M L Yeung and stated the intention was to find cover behind STRAIGHT TO GLORY but when that runner jumped awkwardly Jockey Yeung was unable to comply with the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 300 Metres raced tight to the outside of SIGHT HERMOSO which shifted out when being checked away from FLOWING RICHES.  Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when racing tight to the outside of SIGHT HERMOSO.

On jumping was crowded between RIDING HIGH and TSUEN WAN GLORY which shifted out.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight J Orman stated that after being positioned behind RAGNARR on straightening he was briefly held up behind that runner leaving the 400 Metres.  He said after then shifting to the outside of RAGNARR he continued to ride his mount along when positioned behind VIVA CHALEUR.  He added that near the 150 Metres when VIVA CHALEUR was laying out as it was being ridden along he then elected to shift to the inside of VIVA CHALEUR to obtain clear running as he was concerned that VIVA CHALEUR would continue to shift out.  He stated that when VIVA CHALEUR maintained a straight course thereafter he had some difficulty obtaining clear running for a short distance near the 100 Metres when improving into a tight run between VIVA CHALEUR and RUN YES RUN.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Orman were reasonable in the circumstances.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with VIVA CHALEUR.  Passing the 900 Metres was bumped on the hindquarters by RAGNARR which shifted out when being steadied away from VERBIER.  GLORIOUS EXPERT was then obliged to race very wide and without cover thereafter.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping.  H Bowman stated that the intention was to find a position with cover.  He said in the early stages when he was unable to comply with his instructions he allowed RIDING HIGH to stride forward but when unable to cross the leaders RIDING HIGH was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added as a result in the Home Straight his mount was left without a finishing effort.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start, was bumped and became unbalanced.   Apprentice P N Wong stated that she was obliged to make use of her mount in the early stages to race outside the lead which resulted in TSUEN WAN GLORY then giving ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer K L Man concurred with the views of Apprentice Wong and also stated that the horse was disadvantaged by being up in weight as compared to its last start win.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of TSUEN WAN GLORY, a last start winner, was considered disappointing.  Before being allowed to race again, TSUEN WAN GLORY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Despite being ridden along in the early stages did not show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
No report.

Passing the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid MY WISH (A Badel) which shifted in when not clear.  A Badel was severely reprimanded.  In this incident HAPPY TOGETHER was crowded between VOYAGE BUBBLE and MOMENTS IN TIME.  Near the 300 Metres M F Poon dropped his whip.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages M F Poon stated that the instructions were to take up an on-pace position behind the leaders.  He said in the early stages he was unable to cross runners to his inside which resulted in VOYAGE BUBBLE being caught in a three wide position.  He stated that as a result he then elected to ride his mount forward with a view to crossing HAPPY TOGETHER and at the same time requiring MY WISH to have to be ridden forward to cross and race outside the lead.  He said after being crowded by MY WISH leaving the 900 Metres he was then obliged to race in a position three wide and without cover thereafter.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions were to hold an on-pace position whilst acknowledging it may have been difficult for the horse to obtain cover with a number of light weight runners drawn to its inside.  After considering his explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Poon that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages by continuing forward to make too much use of his mount to cross runners to his inside, particularly with his mount racing first up and carrying top weight of 135 lbs.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned L Hewitson stated that after entering the Home Straight he improved to the inside of SUPER PACE with a view to obtaining clear running inside NEBRASKAN.  He stated that as his mount commenced to improve NEBRASKAN shifted in which then resulted in STAR FIGURE being crowded for room between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres and having to be steadied as a consequence.  As the Stewards were satisfied that STAR FIGURE had not established clear running to the inside of NEBRASKAN before NEBRASKAN commenced to shift in no action was taken.  Sent for sampling post-race.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the middle stages.  When questioned regarding his riding Apprentice E C W Wong stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages and endeavour to obtain runs to the inside in the Home Straight.  He said after settling back in the field his mount was positioned behind CALIFORNIA DEEPLY throughout the race and from the 500 Metres he elected to remain racing behind that runner to comply with his instructions to take inside runs.  He added that when VON BAER continued to travel well this resulted in it improving to the inside of CALIFORNIA DEEPLY and then being held up behind FLYING TING LOK in the Home Straight.  When questioned as to why he did not improve to the outside of CALIFORNIA DEEPLY Apprentice Wong stated that his focus was on complying with his instructions but in retrospect he agreed with the Stewards that his best option would have been to improve to the outside of CALIFORNIA DEEPLY after the 500 Metres.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued and in particular confirmed he had requested Apprentice Wong to endeavour to take runs towards the inside in the Home Straight.  After considering his explanation and the instructions issued the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Apprentice Wong were reasonable in the circumstances.
