After travelling a short distance was eased when crowded between WOODFIRE CHAMP and COLONEL which shifted out.  K C Leung (WOODFIRE CHAMP) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the first turn near the 1000 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of CAMP FIRE, resulting in CAMP FIRE having to be checked to avoid WOODFIRE CHAMP.  K C Leung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Thursday, 30 October 2025 at Sha Tin.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his excellent race riding record.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

K C Leung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the first turn near the 1000 Metres (see CAMP FIRE).  K C Leung could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  Trainer C W Chang advised the horse had pleased him leading into the race and expected it to perform well.  He could offer no excuse for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of WOODFIRE CHAMP was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, WOODFIRE CHAMP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
No report.
Hampered shortly after the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  For a short distance near the 100 Metres was held up for clear running behind BASIC INSTINCT.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Lay in in the Home Straight and near the 50 Metres was shifted to the inside of SIGHT HAPPY to continue into clear running.
Bumped heavily at the start and became unbalanced.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was crowded between BASIC INSTINCT and SIGHT HAPPY which was taken out by SILVER SPURS.  Near the 50 Metres was steadied to avoid SHOTGUN (M F Poon) which shifted in when not clear.  M F Poon was advised to exercise more care.  L Ferraris stated that his mount travelled only fairly during the running of the race and was unable to run on when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped heavily at the start and became unbalanced.
In the middle stages raced keenly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 300 Metres RISING PHOENIX commenced to improve to the inside of HAPPY BUDDIES (K C Leung).  A short distance later RISING PHOENIX was then shifted to the inside to obtain clear running before Jockey Leung corrected his mount.  As a consequence RISING PHOENIX was then checked when it was crowded by HAPPY BUDDIES.  K C Leung was severely reprimanded and advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to ensure that he is clear before shifting ground.  However, the Stewards were satisfied that he had endeavoured to straighten his mount just prior to shifting in into the running of RISING PHOENIX.  RISING PHOENIX was then shifted to the outside of HAPPY BUDDIES and SUPER PACE to obtain clear running near the 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

H Bowman stated that his instructions were to go forward from his wide barrier.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside this resulted in DENFIELD being obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Trainer C S Shum confirmed the instructions and said he issued those instructions as he believed it was advantageous to race in a more forward position having regard to the track pattern tonight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Withdrawn on 20.10.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (left front tendon injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter WARRIORS DREAM.  Before being allowed to race again, FIELD MARSHAL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Near the 1500 Metres was steadied when crowded by STAR CONTACT.  Near the 1000 Metres was briefly crowded by IVY LEAGUE which lay in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
No report.

K De Melo reported that leaving the 50 Metres he briefly stopped riding when he heard a call from a rider to his inside.  He added that once he ascertained he was clear he continued to ride his mount out to the finish.

Near the 1500 Metres was bumped heavily and became unbalanced.  Whilst the Stewards were satisfied that the riding of B Avdulla, 6th placegetter, over the concluding stages did not affect the horse’s finishing position, he was nonetheless reminded of his obligation to ensure that he fully rides his mounts out to the finish of the race.
Jumped only fairly.
K Teetan stated that his mount jumped only fairly and as a result settled further back in the field than what had been anticipated.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Y L Chung (LOVERO) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 1500 Metres he permitted his mount to shift in when not clear of ONE MORE, resulting in ONE MORE having to be checked and taken in onto STAR CONTACT, causing ONE MORE to make heavy contact with STAR CONTACT, resulting in STAR CONTACT becoming unbalanced in this incident.  After assessing the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and having regard to his record, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty to be a reprimand.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Y L Chung was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 1500 Metres (see ONE MORE).  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shortly after the start was crowded by SOVEREIGN FUND which shifted in and away from BUNDLE OF CHARM.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Over-raced throughout the early and middle stages and refused to settle.
No report.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.

A Badel stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions and said he issued those instructions to offset the wide barrier.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

B Avdulla stated that when placed under pressure in the Home Straight his mount responded only fairly to his riding which he attributed to STORMING DRAGON having to carry additional weight after its last start win on 10 September 2025.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
When caught wide in the early stages was shifted behind runners from the outside barrier.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Sent for sampling post-race.
M Chadwick stated that with his mount stepping up in distance today CALIFORNIA BANNER was able to hold a more forward position than its previous race starts.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up for a short distance near the 400 Metres. K De Melo reported that near the 150 Metres his whip was knocked from his grasp by the whip of A Badel, rider of WORLD HERO.
No report.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and as to whether there was an opportunity to place his mount under pressure sooner than what he did A Atzeni stated that there had been no specific instructions other than to attempt to hold a handy position.  He said when complying with his instructions MR COOL was unable to obtain cover and as a result was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He said entering the Home Straight MR COOL improved into the race without being pressured to do so and given his mount was carrying top weight of 135 lbs he was of the opinion it was in the horse’s best interests to allow it to continue to improve without being pressured to do so as it was making ground on the leaders.  He added near the 250 Metres he then commenced to ride his mount along where MR COOL then finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  He said he also rode the horse in this manner in the early stages of the Home Straight as MR COOL had shown the ability to finish off strongly when it barrier trialed on 14 October 2025 when successful on that occasion.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Atzeni in the circumstances were reasonable.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted out.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded for room between REZEKI which shifted in after making contact with GROOVY FEELING and APPEALING CITY which shifted out.  Near the 450 Metres endeavoured to shift out to obtain clear running and made contact with REZEKI.  Leaving the 100 Metres was held up behind ONLY U.  In this incident SILVER UP shifted out and made contact with REZEKI.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the improved performance of TIME TO FIRE Trainer D J Hall stated that the horse was advantaged by the addition of sheepskin cheek pieces and also by being stepped up in distance to 1600 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  After being crossed by PEARL OF PANG’S near the 1300 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being checked to avoid PEARL OF PANG’S.  L Ferraris was reprimanded for using his whip in a forehand manner forward of the saddle on one occasion near the 100 Metres.  L Ferraris was found guilty of a careless riding charge for contributing to interference near the 100 Metres (see ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT).  Sent for sampling post-race.
When caught wide in the early stages was eased to obtain a position with cover near the 1200 Metres.  Lay in over the final 100 Metres.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 1300 Metres was bumped heavily by ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT and became unbalanced. Near the 500 Metres was bumped by PEARL OF PANG’S.  Near the 50 Metres was struck across the head by the whip of L Ferraris, rider of BRIGHT INHERITANCE, and as a result got its head up, became unbalanced and could not be ridden out over the concluding stages. A Atzeni was found guilty of a careless riding charge for contributing to interference near the 100 Metres (see ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT).

Held up for clear running between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres.  Approaching the 150 Metres was eased when disappointed for clear running between THE HEIR and ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT which was taken in. M L Yeung was reprimanded in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on several occasions in the Home Straight.
Near the 100 Metres was hampered and taken in when crowded.
Jumped only fairly.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Near the 100 Metres was hampered and taken in when crowded.
Near the 100 Metres was hampered and taken in when crowded.  After being interfered with near the 100 Metres was then unable to be ridden out to the finish of the race.

Shifted out at the start and made contact with BULL ATTITUDE.  Near the 1500 Metres became badly unbalanced when bumped heavily by BULL ATTITUDE (A Atzeni) which shifted in.  A Atzeni was reprimanded and advised that he would be expected to make a greater effort to straighten his mount sooner than what he did on this occasion.  Near the 1300 Metres was checked to avoid PEARL OF PANG’S when that runner shifted out when racing behind SPLENDID FORCE.  As a result ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT made heavy contact with BULL ATTITUDE.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  L Ferraris (BRIGHT INHERITANCE) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of BULL ATTITUDE, resulting in BULL ATTITUDE being taken in and contributing to ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT having to be checked and further resulting in THE HEIR, SOARING BRONCO and SERANGOON being crowded and SERANGOON being taken in across the running of GOOD GOOD which was also checked.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  After considering the contribution from BULL ATTITUDE, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty was a fine of $30,000 be applied equivalent to half of his average daily earnings.  A Atzeni (BULL ATTITUDE) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 100 Metres after being taken in by BRIGHT INHERITANCE he allowed his mount to shift in and failed to make sufficient effort to prevent it from shifting in when not clear of ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT and contributing to ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT having to be checked, resulting in THE HEIR, SOARING BRONCO and SERANGOON being crowded and SERANGOON being taken in onto GOOD GOOD which was also checked.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.  After considering the contribution from BRIGHT INHERITANCE, the Stewards determined the appropriate penalty was a fine of $30,000 be applied equivalent to half of his average daily earnings.

When questioned regarding the disappointing performance K C Leung stated that his mount travelled only fairly during the running of the race and making the Home Turn he endeavoured to shift out to take BULL ATTITUDE wider.  He said when PEARL OF PANG’S did not respond to his efforts to so do it made contact with BULL ATTITUDE before failing to run on in the Home Straight.  He added that, in his view, PEARL OF PANG’S did not appreciate the "Good to Firm” track conditions, particularly as it did not travel well during the running of the race.  Trainer K L Man concurred with the opinion of Jockey Leung that the horse did not appreciate the "Good to Firm” track conditions.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
The tongue tie was replaced at the Start.  Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 500 Metres made contact with MASSIVE SOVEREIGN which shifted in slightly.  Approaching the 350 Metres lay in and away from MASSIVE SOVEREIGN and made contact with HONG LOK GOLF when it was being corrected by its rider C L Chau.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Passing the 1000 Metres was checked to avoid SAGACIOUS LIFE (Apprentice P N Wong) which shifted in abruptly as it was being corrected by its rider.  As the Stewards were satisfied that Apprentice Wong had taken the appropriate action to straighten her mount no action was taken.

Shifted in near the 500 Metres and was bumped.  When questioned regarding his riding B Avdulla stated that he was able to take up a handy position throughout the early and middle stages.  He said when SAGACIOUS LIFE shifted in abruptly towards the rail near the 900 Metres he was required to allow MASSIVE SOVEREIGN to stride forward to avoid SAGACIOUS LIFE forcing him wider.  He said as he did so MASSIVE SOVEREIGN then commenced to race keenly behind STEPS AHEAD for some distance thereafter.  He added that leaving the 600 Metres he elected to allow MASSIVE SOVEREIGN to improve to the outside of STEPS AHEAD to prevent it from continuing to over-race and to also make a forward move as he was concerned MASSIVE SOVEREIGN would take some time to respond to his riding under its top weight of 135 lbs.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Avdulla were reasonable in the circumstances.
No report.
Near the 350 Metres was badly crowded by STEPS AHEAD which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
Bumped at the start. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on 2 consecutive strides near the 450 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres was bumped and became unbalanced.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Held up for clear running approaching the 400 Metres.  Near the 400 Metres endeavoured to improve into a narrow run between VOYAGE SAMURAI and SKY HEART when there was not quite sufficient room to do so.  As JOHANNES BRAHMS continued to improve to the inside of SKY HEART it then was checked near the 350 Metres when SKY HEART was taken in by HONG LOK GOLF which shifted in when being badly crowded by STEPS AHEAD (C L Chau) when that runner lay in and away from MASSIVE SOVEREIGN.  C L Chau was severely reprimanded and advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to make a greater effort to prevent his mounts from shifting in to avoid making contact with other runners.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 350 Metres was eased to avoid JOHANNES BRAHMS when that horse was checked.  K C Leung reported that his mount was disadvantaged by being pressured in the lead in the early stages which resulted in it giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of VOYAGE SAMURAI, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, VOYAGE SAMURAI will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore).  Before being allowed to race again, HUGE WAVE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Ran out abruptly near the 550 Metres despite the efforts of its rider J Orman to prevent the horse from shifting ground (protest/objection – see GEORGIAN SIGMA).  Trainer M Newnham was advised that EVER LUCK will be required to perform satisfactorily in a turf track gallop around a bend at Sha Tin Racecourse and also a barrier trial around a bend prior to being permitted to race again.  Sent for sampling post-race.

The Stewards deferred the declaration of weighed-in due to an incident occurred after the 550 Metres where the 2nd placegetter GEORGIAN SIGMA was badly hampered when taken wider by the winner EVER LUCK.  Subsequently the Stewards considered a protest/objection lodged by Jockey Z Purton and Trainer P C Ng alleging interference against EVER LUCK after the 550 Metres.  After considering all the evidence it was established that EVER LUCK ran out abruptly near the 550 Metres despite the efforts of its rider J Orman to prevent the horse from shifting ground.  In this incident GEORGIAN SIGMA was badly hampered when taken wider.  After considering the incident, the manner in which both horses finished the race off and the margin of 1 ¾ lengths between the two horses at the end of the race, the Stewards overruled the protest/objection when they could not be comfortably satisfied that had the interference not have occurred that GEORGIAN SIGMA would have finished in advance of EVER LUCK.  Accordingly, weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  Z Purton stated that after being badly hampered near the 550 Metres his mount, which was having its first race start, became unbalanced and took some time to respond to his riding in the early stages of the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Near the 550 Metres was steadied away from GEORGIAN SIGMA when that runner was taken out by EVER LUCK.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 500 Metres was shifted to the outside of ALABAMA SONG to obtain clear running when ALABAMA SONG shifted in after initially being taken wider.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of its starting gate, shifted out and made contact with SUPER MASTERMIND.  Leaving the 400 Metres endeavoured to improve to the inside of SUPER MASTERMIND (H Bowman) as that runner then shifted in.  H Bowman was reprimanded and advised he must ensure he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
On jumping shifted out and made contact with HYANNIS STAR, resulting in MAZING GRACE becoming unbalanced.
Jumped only fairly.
Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  Leaving the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly when steadied away from ZHOU GONGJIN.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped only fairly and then became unbalanced when bumped by MAZING GRACE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

On jumping was bumped by GROOVY FEELING, shifted in and then made contact with SILVER UP.  Near the 450 Metres was bumped by SILVER UP.  Bumped near the 100 Metres.  H Bowman stated that his mount settled further back in the field after being crowded at the start.
No report.
Bounded on jumping and lost ground.  Z Purton expressed satisfaction with his mount’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped. Shortly after the start was eased when crowded by MR COOL which shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and refused to settle.  The performance of APPEALING CITY, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, APPEALING CITY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by YIU CHEUNG VICTORY which shifted in.  Between the 350 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.  Lay out when placed under pressure in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the winning post could not be fully ridden out when positioned close to the heels of ON THE LASH.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Near the 350 Metres was accidentally struck across its head by the whip of J Orman, rider of SMASHING EXPRESS.  Approaching the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 550 Metres was shifted to the outside of CELESTIAL HARMONY to improve and made contact with SMART BEAUTY.  In the early stages of the Home Straight lay in, resulting in its rider J Orman changing his whip through to his right hand near the 350 Metres.  J Orman was reprimanded in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 350 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 150 Metres made contact with PHANTOM CYCLONE due to both runners shifting ground.  Near the 100 Metres was hampered when taken wider by STRONGEST BOY.
For some distance near the 600 Metres was steadied when held up behind SMASHING EXPRESS.

Jumped only fairly and then was steadied and blundered badly when crowded between CELESTIAL HARMONY and PHANTOM CYCLONE which shifted out and away from FUNG.  When questioned M Chadwick stated that his mount raced keenly in the early stages and was steadied to avoid GO GO GO near the 1000 Metres. He said near the 900 Metres his mount became unbalanced when crowded for room by PHANTOM CYCLONE.  The Stewards were satisfied that C L Chau, rider of PHANTOM CYCLONE, had made sufficient effort to prevent his mount from shifting in and away from SMART BEAUTY.  M Chadwick added that after this incident STRONGEST BOY did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when unable to improve between GOLD TACK which shifted in slightly and STRONGEST BOY which shifted out.  Approaching the 150 Metres made contact with MR ALADDIN due to both runners shifting ground.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.
Bumped near the 550 Metres.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

The performance of FUNG, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, FUNG will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 100 Metres was checked to avoid SERANGOON.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
H Bentley could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

As the start was effected bounded in the air, resulting in its rider A Badel becoming unbalanced and being dislodged.  As the Stewards were satisfied that the horse had been afforded a fair start it was declared a runner.  Before being allowed to race again, ABSOLUTE AWAKENED will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Subsequently A Badel was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagements.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied to avoid RUBY SAILING which shifted out.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.  Near the 200 Metres was bumped by FLYING BOOM and as a result became momentarily unbalanced. K De Melo was reprimanded for using the whip on 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid RUBY SAILING which was taken in by WINNING NOW (A Badel) which shifted in when not clear.  A Badel was reprimanded.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.

Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  For some distance after the 400 Metres was held up for clear running.  Near the 200 Metres FLYING BOOM made contact with CHEVAL VICTORIOUS when being shifted to the outside of JUBILANT STAR to obtain clear running.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Near the 850 Metres was steadied to avoid JUBILANT STAR.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running.  Near the 150 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running to the inside of RUBY SAILING which shifted in when commencing to give ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the middle stages lay out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly and then became unbalanced when bumped by NYX GLUCK which shifted out.
Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.
When placed under pressure in the Home Straight lay in, raced greenly and proved difficult to ride out.

K Teetan stated that his mount enjoyed a comfortable run during the race but failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and, in his view, would derive a fitness benefit from today’s performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by ENTHRALLED which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Held up on the Home Turn.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have blood in the mouth due to a small abrasion to the lip.
In the early stages raced keenly and near the 1500 Metres was steadied away from ROMANTIC THOR.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  When questioned regarding his riding R Kingscote stated that he was instructed to hold a handy position preferably with cover.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and when KING OF SELECTION was positioned to his outside he elected to allow AGENDA to stride forward to attempt to obtain a position with cover.  He said when unable to obtain cover he allowed AGENDA to stride forward with a view to racing to the outside of S J TOURBILLON.  He said when S J TOURBILLON then shifted away from the rail this resulted in AGENDA continuing to race wide and therefore he elected to allow the horse to continue forward.  He added after S J TOURBILLON crossed to the lead he endeavoured to steady his mount to set a more sustainable pace but did not wish to place too much pressure on the horse to avoid it over-racing.  He said although he was aware the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time he felt it was in the best interests of the horse to maintain a comfortable rhythm as AGENDA is one-paced and would have to be able to run out a strong 2000 Metres.  After considering his explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Kingscote that, wherever possible, he should endeavour to set a more sustainable pace to afford his horses with the best opportunity to finish the race off.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Near the 750 Metres became unbalanced when positioned tight to the inside of WITHALLMYFAITH.  H Bowman stated that his mount was disadvantaged by the early and middle stages of the race being run inside of standard time and was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of ENTHRALLED, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, ENTHRALLED will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned regarding her riding in the early and middle stages and in particular the fast pace that was set during the running of the race Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions were to lead the event.  She said in the early stages when crossed by MIGHTY STRENGTH she was content to remain racing behind that runner but after being crossed her mount commenced to race keenly and for this reason she shifted to the outside of MIGHTY STRENGTH with a view to maintaining a position to that horse’s outside.  She added when AGENDA improved to her outside near the 1500 Metres S J TOURBILLON continued to race keenly and refused to settle which resulted in the horse racing forward and crossing MIGHTY STRENGTH to lead.  She said although she was aware that the pace of the event was fast she was unable to set a slower tempo due to AGENDA being positioned to her outside.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of S J TOURBILLON, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, S J TOURBILLON will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  A Badel was fined the sum of $5,000 for breaching Rule 100(3)(ii)(f) in that he used his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 150 Metres.  Near the 100 Metres A Badel dropped his whip.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
Blundered on jumping.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
No report.
Shifted in on jumping, was bumped and became unbalanced.

Passing the 200 Metres H Bowman fumbled with his whip for a number of strides before being able to regather it.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid ALSONSO (B Avdulla) which shifted out to obtain a position on the running rail.  B Avdulla was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Bumped on jumping and became unbalanced.  Z Purton stated that his mount gave ground over the final 200 Metres and he could offer no explanation for its disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

On jumping shifted in and made heavy contact with the right side of the starting gate, resulting in its rider A Atzeni becoming unbalanced and being dislodged.  The barrier manners of CHILL BUDDY were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CHILL BUDDY will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial.  Subsequently it was determined that A Atzeni was not suitable to fulfil his remaining riding engagement and permission was given for H Bentley to be substituted as the rider of ARMOUR WAR EAGLE in Race 10.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight and as to whether there was an opportunity to shift to the outside of HELIOS EXPRESS sooner than he did B Avdulla stated that his instructions today were similar to those issued at previous starts to hold the horse up for one final run as RAGING BLIZZARD does not possess the ability to sustain a long run.  He said with these instructions in mind he followed HELIOS EXPRESS into the Home Straight where he remained racing behind that horse.  He added that he had expected HELIOS EXPRESS to take him into the event further than it did which required him then to shift to that runner’s outside near the 250 Metres where he placed his mount under full pressure and it ran home well.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Shifted in near the 1100 Metres and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 1100 Metres was bumped by FAST NETWORK which shifted in.

As the start was effected lowered its head, resulting in INVINCIBLE SHIELD being slow to begin.  A warning was placed on the barrier manners of the horse.
Leaving the 800 Metres raced tight to the inside of BEAUTY WAVES.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start, made contact with KA YING SUPERB and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race. Z Purton was reprimanded for using the whip on 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres.
Bumped at the start and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 700 Metres shifted out when being steadied to avoid TOP DRAGON.  Making the Home Turn was then taken wider by TOP DRAGON which shifted out to improve.  M F Poon stated that from the outside barrier he was instructed to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer D J Hall confirmed the instructions and said he issued those instructions as he was of the view there was superior pace drawn to the inside and that the horse had performed disappointingly at the conclusion of last preparation when it was ridden forward to lead from a wide barrier.
No report.
No report.
Over the concluding stages could not be ridden out when held up behind ANODE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.

Jumped only fairly and then raced tight to the inside of SIX PACK shortly after the start.  Leaving the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was steadied away from SIX PACK.  Again near the 500 Metres was steadied away from SIX PACK.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when improving between KA YING ATTACK and IGOR STRAVINSKY.

Held up making the Home Turn.  After being shifted to the inside of DAZZLING FIT, ARMOUR WAR EAGLE was then held up for clear running for a short distance behind KA YING SUPERB near the 350 Metres.  After being shifted to the inside of KA YING SUPERB, ARMOUR WAR EAGLE was again held up for clear running behind ONE MAN SHOW near the 200 Metres when that runner was giving ground.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped awkwardly and made contact with ANODE.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on the hindquarters on jumping and became unbalanced.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, KA YING SUPERB will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Withdrawn on 25.10.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (fever).  Before being allowed to race again, LO PAN SPIRIT will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After the winning post raced tight to the inside of COURIER MAGIC (C L Chau) which shifted in when being ridden along.  C L Chau was advised to exercise more care and to stop riding and straighten his mounts in similar circumstances.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with ALL EYES ON ME.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 1300 Metres improved into a narrow run to the inside of GO GO GO and as a result got its head up when being steadied.  Held up for clear running between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.

No report.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped on jumping.

Jumped only fairly, shifted out, made contact with VIEW ALL THINGS and became unbalanced.

K Teetan reported that from the outside barrier his instructions were to take up a forward position.  He added that when unable to cross runners to his inside HARRY’S HERO was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  Trainer P F Yiu confirmed the instructions and said those instructions were issued on the basis that he did not want the horse to get too far back in the early stages and to endeavour to take advantage of the relatively light weight of 120 lbs.

Shortly after the start bumped with GO GO GO.  M Chadwick reported that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race and was under pressure from the 600 Metres before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Bumped at the start.  Z Purton could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.
Withdrawn on 29.10.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore).  Before being allowed to race again, RUN YES RUN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 700 Metres was steadied when endeavouring to improve between VIVA TASTE which was racing tight to the inside of MEGA FORCE an SOARING BRONCO which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  On jumping blundered, became unbalanced and lost ground.  Raced very wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly and then bumped with SPECIAL HEDGE shortly after.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn and near the 350 Metres was eased when placed in restricted room between SPECIAL HEDGE and KASA PAPA which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.

Approaching the 200 Metres was contacted by SUPREME AGILITY and became unbalanced as SUPREME AGILITY (J Orman) improved into a doubtful run between KASA PAPA and YOUNG BRILLIANT which was giving ground.  J Orman was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure that there is sufficient racing room when improving into runs.  When questioned A Badel stated that as he entered the Home Straight he was obliged to correct his mount when he received a call from the rider of SOARING BRONCO who was positioned to his outside.  He said a short distance later he endeavoured to secure clear running between GALE SAGA and YOUNG BRILLIANT but when his mount did not respond to his efforts to improve it then was crowded for room when SUPREME AGILITY shifted out approaching the 200 Metres.
Bumped on jumping.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Jumped only fairly.

K Teetan reported that his mount hung out throughout the event and in particular when giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly, resulting in its rider D Probert becoming unbalanced.  A short distance later DASHING DRAGON made contact with GALE SAGA due to both horses shifting ground.

Was retired from the race after the 600 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  As this was the second occasion that SIGHT SUPREME had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
Sent for sampling post-race.

When questioned regarding his riding M L Yeung stated that his mount was shifted across behind runners in the early stages from the outside barrier.  He said throughout the event NO OTHER CHOICE appeared to resent the kickback, particularly as it was having its first race start on the All Weather surface.  He said as a result making the Home Turn and in the Home Straight he shifted NO OTHER CHOICE to the outside to endeavour to improve into the event at which point the horse lay out.  He said after shifting to the outside of DASH near the 200 Metres he then changed his whip from his left to his right hand to encourage the horse to respond but as he did so he had some difficulty in pulling the whip through.  He added that once he was able to fully ride his mount along over the final 150 Metres NO OTHER CHOICE found the line strongly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was contacted on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out and made contact with HE WAS YOU, resulting in JOLLY COMPANION losing ground.
Jumped only fairly.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 350 Metres made contact with BEAUTY THUNDER and became unbalanced due to both runners shifting ground.  Bumped approaching the winning post.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Near the 350 Metres made contact with NEW POWER and became unbalanced due to both runners shifting ground.  Approaching the winning post shifted in and made contact with NEW POWER and as a result was not ridden out to the finish of the event.  H Bentley stated that the instructions from a wide barrier were to go forward.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside his mount was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight as it was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Bumped shortly after the start.  After being crossed by HE WAS YOU near the 800 Metres commenced to race keenly and for some distance thereafter got its head up when steadied away from HE WAS YOU.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped shortly after the start.  L Ferraris stated that, in his opinion, the horse, which was having its first race start on the All Weather surface, did not appear to be comfortable racing on the track.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race. H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on 2 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres.
Jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.
Jumped only fairly and then shortly afterwards was bumped by FORTUNE WARRIOR which shifted out.
No report.
M Chadwick reported his mount jumped awkwardly and as a consequence lost ground at the start.
No report.

Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  A Atzeni stated that his mount jumped well and was able to cross to the lead without being unduly pressured to do so.  He said he was content in holding this position as GIDDY UP had barrier trialed well when ridden in a similar position.  Trainer J Richards confirmed the instructions were to settle where comfortable and was satisfied with Jockey Atzeni’s decision to go forward and lead when it was able to obtain that position with limited pressure being applied.

Jumped awkwardly. Making the turn near the 600 Metres lay out and as a result ran wide.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

L Hewitson reported that his mount hung out during the race and failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of DAILY TROPHY, a last start winner, was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, DAILY TROPHY will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Blundered on jumping and shortly after made contact with WINNING MACHINE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and as a result lost ground.  Near the 500 Metres was taken wider by DAILY TROPHY which hung out.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Over the final 50 Metres could not be ridden out when racing tight to the inside of LUCKY BLESSING.

Bumped on jumping.  Z Purton could offer no excuse for his mount’s failure to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  After the 300 Metres was shifted to the outside of MACANESE MASTER to attempt to obtain clear running.  As SUPER CHARIZZARD was being shifted to the outside, MACANESE MASTER (Apprentice P N Wong) commenced to give ground and shifted out slightly, resulting in SUPER CHARIZZARD having to be checked passing the 250 Metres when disappointed for clear running between SONIC BOOM and MACANESE MASTER.  As a consequence SUPER CHARIZZARD was held up between the 250 Metres and the 100 Metres.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.

M L Yeung stated that his mount failed to travel during the race and, in his opinion, is better suited racing at Sha Tin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned Apprentice P N Wong stated that her instructions from the outside barrier were to lead the event.  She said on jumping MACANESE MASTER jumped awkwardly, shifted out and as a result lost some ground.  She said having regard to her instructions she elected to ride MACANESE MASTER forward to attempt to cross runners to her inside but when unable to do so MACANESE MASTER was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  When questioned if there was an opportunity to ride MACANESE MASTER in a conservative manner in the early stages, given the horse had jumped awkwardly, Apprentice Wong stated that when she thought that it was still possible to comply with her instructions as she was of the opinion a number of runners to her inside were not being ridden forward, she elected to ride her mount forward to comply with the instructions.  Trainer Y S Tsui confirmed the instructions issued.

Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and found to be lame in its left front leg.  Acting on veterinary advice that SUNNY DARLING was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, SUNNY DARLING will be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 400 Metres the left stirrup used by Apprentice E C W Wong broke, resulting in Apprentice Wong completing the remainder of the race without the use of his left stirrup.  After inspecting his stirrups, in the presence of the Chief Riding Instructor, Mr F Coetzee, he was advised he should ensure that at all times he maintains his gear in good working condition.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Blundered on jumping. A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained a laceration to the left hind leg.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the middle stages lay in and away from NEVER PETER OUT and made contact with the running rail near the 800 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the horse leading H Bentley stated that his instructions were to settle the horse where comfortable but had not anticipated leading the event.  He said after DAN ATTACK jumped well and was caught very wide in the early stages he elected to allow the horse to stride forward and lead to avoid covering additional ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between JUICY DRAGON and ALL’S WELL which shifted out slightly. K Teetan was severely reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 4 consecutive strides near the 250 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.

Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of JUICY DRAGON.  After the race an endoscopic examination was conducted on DENFIELD at the request of Trainer C S Shum.  The Veterinary Surgeon said this examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, DENFIELD will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Was left racing wide and without cover from the 700 Metres.
Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
No report.

Near the 150 Metres was steadied when crowded between WITH A SMILE and DENFIELD (H Bowman) which shifted to the outside of JUICY DRAGON to obtain clear running.  H Bowman was reprimanded and advised to exercise more care in similar circumstances.  M Chadwick reported that after being crowded near the 900 Metres his mount finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 1100 Metres made contact with WITH A SMILE when WITH A SMILE was racing tight to the inside of SONIC PURSUIT and when ALL’S WELL shifted out slightly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped only fairly.  D Probert reported that his mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, raced greenly throughout the event and in the early stages was steadied away from HARMONY GALAXY when racing keenly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

H Bowman stated that whilst he was asked to endeavour to hold a forward position, when his mount jumped well today, he elected to take advantage of the good start to cross in the early stages which resulted in ARGENTO OCEAN holding a more forward position than expected.  H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.

M Chadwick reported that his instructions were to hold an on-pace position.  He said when LUCKY MCQUEEN jumped only fairly and then raced greenly during the race it settled further back in the field than what had been intended.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

He said in the Home Straight his mount did not respond to his riding and the only explanation he could offer was that when the horse won its first race start on 9 July 2025 it was advantaged by being able to obtain a position on the running rail.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When he was satisfied there were not sufficient grounds he declined to lodge a protest/objection and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.

Blundered on jumping, shifted out and made contact with SECOND TO NONE. He said when he was unable to cross runners to his inside in the early stages his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm and also found the horse to have a substantial amount of blood in its trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, GOOD FORTUNE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On exiting the Parade Ring R Kingscote was dislodged, resulting in SNOWTHORN galloping a considerable distance before being recaptured.  Acting on veterinary advice that SNOWTHORN was not suitable to race the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, SNOWTHORN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 31.10.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (heart irregularity) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter SUPER PACE. R Kingscote reported that his mount was fractious in the barriers and when being assisted by the starting gate handler its bridle shifted, resulting in it becoming unsecured.  He said as a result in the early stages he was obliged to reach forward to reposition the bridle to its correct position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.
No report.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Raced keenly in the early stages.  Y L Chung reported that his instructions were to lead the event.  He said his mount jumped awkwardly and as a result was slow to begin and was then hampered by MR ALADDIN which was taken out.  He added as a consequence WAH MAY WAI WAI settled further back in the field than intended.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Kicked a rail before entering the track.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Shortly after the start became unbalanced when bumped by ROMANTIC FANTASY which shifted out and away from LEATHER MASTER.  H Bentley reported that in the Home Straight when placed under pressure his mount was one-paced and did not respond strongly to his riding.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

When questioned regarding the improved performance as compared to its previous two starts Trainer P C Ng stated that he attributed today’s improved performance to the horse racing at Happy Valley as it has a good record on the track and over the distance.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was crowded between FAMILY KNIGHT which shifted in and DRAGON AIR FORCE which shifted out when being corrected by its rider.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Making the Home Turn was held up behind GOLDEN EMPIRE and when racing tight to the inside of DANCING CLASSICS.
Jumped only fairly and then was hampered when bumped by ROMANTIC SON which shifted out.
Near the 900 Metres made contact with DANCING CLASSICS when both runners contested a position behind SYMBOL OF STRENGTH.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount was able to lead the race comfortably.  She further stated that after entering the Home Straight LUCKY PLANET failed to change its lead leg and came under pressure thereafter before giving ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly, made contact with the left side of the starting gate and then shifted out abruptly.

The tongue tie was refitted on arrival at the Start.  Near the 900 Metres made contact with GOLDEN EMPIRE when both runners contested a position behind SYMBOL OF STRENGTH.  Near the 600 Metres was steadied when crowded between GOLDEN EMPIRE and HAYDAY (K Teetan) which shifted in.  K Teetan was reprimanded.  In assessing the incident the Stewards were mindful that GOLDEN EMPIRE and DANCING CLASSICS had been racing tight for some distance before the interference occurred.  D Probert reported that after his mount made contact with GOLDEN EMPIRE near the 900 Metres and was then steadied when crowded near the 600 Metres it did not run on when asked for an effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Shifted out at the start, was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.

Leaving the 1200 Metres KEEN MOLLY, which was racing ungenerously, was steadied when crowded between DRAGON AIR FORCE which shifted out slightly when being steadied and VIVA GRACIOUSNESS (M Chadwick) which shifted in.  M Chadwick was advised to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  When questioned Z Purton stated that near the 600 Metres when positioned behind MIGHTY STEED he shifted out slightly when NEARLY FINE improved quickly to his outside.  He said as NEARLY FINE continued forward he was then obliged to steady his mount when unable to maintain the position between MIGHTY STEED and NEARLY FINE.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Y L Chung was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 200 Metres.

J Orman reported that on jumping his left foot was dislodged from his stirrup, resulting in him being placed at some disadvantage for a short distance after the start until he was able to reposition his foot into the stirrup.  He added as a consequence ANOTHER ZONDA was unable to obtain a forward position behind the leaders as he had anticipated.
Approaching the 1400 Metres was eased to avoid ANOTHER ZONDA after that runner was positioned tight to the inside of DRAGON AIR FORCE.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 750 Metres commenced to race keenly and after being steadied away from I CAN shifted out and made a forward move from that point.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in abruptly, made contact with the hindquarters of SPIRIT OF PEACE and became unbalanced.
Sent for sampling post-race.

A Atzeni stated that from the outside barrier he was given no specific instructions but when his mount commenced well he was able to take up an on-pace position without having to make too much use of his mount to do so. A Atzeni was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 150 Metres.  He was also warned in relation to using his whip forward of the saddle in a forehand manner on one occasion near the 100 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly and then shortly after the start was crowded between GUSTOSISIMO and YOUTHFUL SPIRITS which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.  Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid SELF IMPROVEMENT (C L Chau) which shifted in when not clear.  C L Chau was reprimanded.
Leaving the 600 Metres lay in and away from SELF IMPROVEMENT and made contact with the running rail.
Y L Chung was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 200 Metres and again near the 150 Metres.

Was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced tight to the inside of RED ELEGANCE near the 400 Metres.  Approaching the 100 Metres was steadied away from YOUTHFUL SPIRITS when that runner was giving ground, resulting in KAHOLO ANGEL being shifted to the outside of YOUTHFUL SPIRITS and racing tight between YOUTH SPIRITS and GUSTOSISIMO for some distance thereafter.

Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by STORM RIDER which shifted out.  Near the 500 Metres was momentarily crowded by KAHOLO ANGEL which lay in.  Near the 400 Metres RED ELEGANCE shifted out to commence a forward move around SUPERB CAPITALIST.  When SUPERB CAPITALIST then shifted out RED ELEGANCE (H Bowman) then shifted back in slightly, resulting in KAHOLO ANGEL, which had improved to the inside of RED ELEGANCE, being taken in onto MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE which was crowded.  H Bowman was advised to exercise more care.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
M L Yeung confirmed that from a wide barrier his instructions were to go forward.
On jumping was checked when crowded by STELLAR EXPRESS which shifted in despite the efforts of its rider.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

On jumping was checked when crowded between SELF IMPROVEMENT and RED ELEGANCE which jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  When questioned M Chadwick stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover in the early stages.  He said near the 500 Metres he endeavoured to obtain a position with cover behind SELF IMPROVEMENT but when that runner shifted out slightly as he was shifting in, his mount inadvertently struck the heels of SELF IMPROVEMENT, blundered and became unbalanced.  M Chadwick was advised that he should ensure he does not position himself too close to the heels of other runners to avoid a similar incident occurring.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted out, bumped with SUPERB CAPITALIST and became unbalanced.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Withdrawn on 1.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter STORM RIDER.  Before being allowed to race again, PACKING BOLE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start, made contact with SANTORINI and became unbalanced.  Over the concluding stages shifted in and away from SPEEDY SMARTIE after being taken in by that runner, resulting in ORIENTAL SURPRISE making contact with HAPPY HORSE and racing tight between HAPPY HORSE and SPEEDY SMARTIE.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted out at the start, made contact with SANTORINI and became unbalanced.  Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards viewed the patrol films to ascertain if there were grounds for a protest/objection against ORIENTAL SURPRISE and SPEEDY SMARTIE.  When the Stewards found that over the concluding stages ORIENTAL SURPRISE shifted in and away from SPEEDY SMARTIE and ALWAYS MY FOLKS shifted out slightly which resulted in HAPPY HORSE being tightened for room between those two runners they could not be satisfied that there were sufficient grounds to lodge a protest/objection and on that basis weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.  C L Chau, rider of SPEEDY SMARTIE, was advised in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground whilst not clear.
Approaching the winning post shifted out slightly and made contact with HAPPY HORSE.
No report.
No report.

In the early stages raced keenly and near the 600 Metres when being crossed by HAPPY TANGO (Y L Chung) got its head up, shifted in and crowded DRAGON SUNRISE.  Y L Chung was advised to ensure he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  Near the 200 Metres shifted in and was bumped.  H Doyle stated that the instructions were to go forward.  She said after her mount jumped only fairly and then was crowded by DIVINE MOONLIGHT it settled further back in the field than intended.

On jumping was crowded between ORIENTAL SURPRISE and HAPPY HORSE, both of which shifted ground.  Approaching the 800 Metres shifted in abruptly when being shifted behind HAPPY HORSE.  Making the turn near the 600 Metres lay in and made contact with the running rail.
L Ferraris advised that from a wide barrier his instructions were to go forward.  Trainer D J Whyte confirmed the instructions issued.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by MODEST GENTLEMAN which shifted in slightly.  Near the 600 Metres became unbalanced when crowded by EVER SMART which shifted in when racing keenly.

Near the 200 Metres was taken in when bumped by EVER SMART which shifted in before being corrected by its rider.  As a consequence HAPPY TANGO was then shifted to the inside of SANTORINI and behind CAMP FIRE and could not be ridden out over the final 100 Metres.

Shifted in at the start despite the efforts of its rider, made contact with EVER SMART and became unbalanced.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Apprentice E C W Wong stated that in the early stages his mount hung in and proved difficult to ride.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start, made contact with VON BAER and became unbalanced.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Making the first turn near the 1000 Metres was eased when being crossed by GRAND NOVA.
Bumped on jumping.
Bumped on jumping.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of CALIFORNIA DEEPLY to continue into clear running.
Approaching the finish was steadied when crowded between BIG RETURN and VON BAER which shifted out and away from NEVER SETTLE after being taken out by that runner.
Bumped approaching the 1000 Metres.

Shortly after the start was eased when crowded between GOLDEN BRILLIANT and NEVER SETTLE, both of which shifted ground slightly.  Approaching the 1000 Metres lay in and away from BASIC INSTINCT and made contact with GOLDEN BRILLIANT.  K Teetan reported that approaching the 250 Metres when endeavouring to shift to the outside of BASIC INSTINCT his mount, which was hanging in, did not respond to his efforts to shift out and as a result blundered when positioned close to the heels of BASIC INSTINCT.  SHOTGUN continued to hang in in the Home Straight.

Bumped on jumping.  Approaching the 150 Metres shifted in.  A short distance later was hampered when taken wider by BIG RETURN which was shifted to the outside of CALIFORNIA DEEPLY to obtain clear running.

L Hewitson reported that the instructions were to go forward from the outside barrier.  He said after pushing his mount soon after the start it did not show sufficient pace to go forward and as a result he elected to ride the horse in a conservative manner, particularly as it was carrying the top weight of 135 lbs.  He added that GLORY B hung out throughout the event and as a result shifted out in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
H Bowman was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 150 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.

C L Chau reported that from the outside barrier he was given the option of holding a more forward position. He said when STORMI commenced well he allowed it to stride forward to take advantage of the good start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
After being crossed by CORLEONE near the 1200 Metres raced keenly for some distance thereafter.

Shortly after the start bumped with GASTRONOMIQUE.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running behind CONSPIRACY WITNESS when that runner was being shifted out to obtain clear running.

Shifted in on jumping and made contact with the starting gates.  Shortly afterwards was then steadied when crowded by ABSOLUTE HONOUR which shifted out.  L Ferraris reported that in this incident his right foot slipped in the stirrup and as a consequence he repositioned his foot into the stirrup near the 1500 Metres.  He added that CONSPIRACY WITNESS did not travel well throughout the event and finished the race off only fairly in the Home Straight.  Trainer D A Hayes advised that the horse had pleased him leading into tonight’s race and, in his opinion, appeared to race "flat”.  He added he would now consider applying sheepskin cheek pieces to the horse for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

Bumped shortly after the start.  Z Purton reported that the intention was to hold a more forward position.  He said after riding his mount along in the early stages he was caught wide and for this reason he elected to ride the horse in a conservative manner to obtain a position with cover.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then was bumped shortly after the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  After being shifted to the inside of ABSOLUTE HONOUR near the 100 Metres then raced greenly to the winning post.
No report.
Jumped awkwardly and got its head up.

Bumped shortly after the start.  In the early stages got its head up when being steadied away from CORLEONE.  Near the 1500 Metres GASTRONOMIQUE was then steadied to avoid WISEMAN which shifted in slightly.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  The performance of GASTRONOMIQUE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GASTRONOMIQUE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Briefly held up for clear running approaching the 250 Metres after improving to the inside of DEVAS TWELVE and made contact with COPARTNER FLEET near the 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
No report.
Bumped shortly after the start.
Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of DEVAS TWELVE.

Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of SPICY GOLD which shifted in.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied when crowded between REGAL GEM which shifted to the outside of COPARTNER FLEET to obtain clear running and SPICY GOLD which shifted in.
Near the 150 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of FORZA TORO to obtain clear running.
Jumped only fairly.  Near the 100 Metres was steadied to avoid NEVER TOO SOON (A Atzeni) which shifted in to obtain clear running.  A Atzeni was advised to exercise more care.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils and was also displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, BIENVENUE will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Bumped shortly after the start.  K Teetan reported that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to hold an on-pace position and as a result COPARTNER FLEET was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out near the 200 Metres to obtain clear running and made contact with CLUB ACE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 200 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when unable to improve between FREE PONY and CLUB ACE which shifted out.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start, resulting in its rider M L Yeung having to correct his mount.
No report.
Near the 200 Metres shifted in and made contact with CHARMING BABE when that runner was being shifted out to obtain clear running.
No report.

Leaving the 600 Metres became unbalanced when it made contact with the running rail whilst racing to the inside of REWARDING BUDDY.  J Orman reported that his mount did not appreciate the "Good to Firm” track conditions.

Jumped awkwardly and shortly after the start was checked when crowded by FREE PONY which shifted out despite the efforts of its rider.  H Doyle reported that after being checked at the start her mount did not respond to her efforts to hold a more forward position and failed to run on in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have an epiglottic entrapment.
Hung out making the Home Turn.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Was examined by the Veterinary Officer on arrival at the Start and found to be lame in the right hind leg.  Acting on veterinary advice that the SIGHT HAPPY was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, SIGHT HAPPY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

H Doyle pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference making the first turn near the 1000 Metres (see NEWBORN MORACLE).  Near the 150 Metres H Doyle dropped her right rein.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Crowded near the 1000 Metres.  Briefly held up approaching the 250 Metres, shifted out and made contact with TOP TO SKY.  Over the final 200 Metres lay out under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Crowded near the 1000 Metres.

H Doyle (RUN RUN SMART) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that making the first turn near the 1000 Metres she allowed her mount to shift in when not clear of LUNAR DASH, resulting in LUNAR DASH being taken in across the running of NEWBORN MIRACLE which was checked and further resulting in NEWBORN MIRACLE being carried in onto TOP TO SKY, causing TOP TO SKY to be taken across the running of PRIDE BELIEVER which was checked, resulting in PRIDE BELIEVER becoming unbalanced and a short distance later shifted in across the running of YEE CHEONG SPIRIT which was also checked.  H Doyle was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 19 November 2025 at Happy Valley.  In addition, she was fined the sum of $60,000.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered her excellent race riding record.
Checked near the 1100 Metres when crowded.  Near the 800 Metres was eased from the heels of NEWBORN MIRACLE which shifted in when being restrained to obtain a position behind TOP TO SKY.
Crowded near the 1000 Metres.  Near the 250 Metres was bumped and taken wider by LUNAR DASH which shifted to the outside of RUN RUN SMART to secure clear running.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by FUN TOGETHER which shifted out.
Crowded near the 1000 Metres.  In the middle stages raced keenly.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 1100 Metres FUN TOGETHER and LEGENDARY IMPACT were checked when crowded between LUNAR DASH which was taken in by RUN RUN SMART (H Doyle) and NEWBORN MIRACLE (M Chadwick) which shifted out when being corrected by its rider to avoid causing interference to its inside.  Both Jockeys Doyle and Chadwick were reprimanded.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

L Ferraris reported that in the middle stages his mount raced keenly and refused to settle.  He said as a consequence it was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.
