Before being allowed to race again, THE REVOLUTION will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Making the Home Turn was hampered when taken wider.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On a number of occasions passing the 100 Metres made contact with  FORTUNE STAR due to both runners shifting ground.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Lay in in the early stages of the Home Straight.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  On a number of occasions passing the 100 Metres made contact with SUNDAY’S SERENADE due to both runners shifting ground. L Ferraris was reprimanded for using the whip on consecutive occasions in 2 consecutive strides near the 200 Metres. He was also reprimanded in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on two occasions near the 150 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Approaching the 300 Metres was checked to avoid YOUNG FIGHTER when that runner hung out making the Home Turn.
Making the Home Turn was hampered and carried wider by YOUNG FIGHTER which hung out.

When questioned R Kingscote stated that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position.  He said in the early stages he was obliged to make use of his mount to cross runners to his inside and when caught in a three wide position he continued to ride his mount forward near the 1500 Metres to encourage KINGDOM OF RICHES to cross to the rail.   He said as a consequence the pace of the event in the early stages was quicker than he had anticipated.  He added that making the Home Turn his mount hung out and as a result ran wide on the turn.  Trainer C Fownes confirmed the instructions issued.
Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race
After improving to the inside of KINGDOM OF RICHES near the 300 Metres was then steadied when crowded by KINGDOM OF RICHES which shifted in when giving ground.

Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Approaching the 400 Metres CALIFORNIA MOXIE (Y L Chung) endeavoured to improve to the inside of BRIGHT MORTAR when there was not sufficient room to do so, resulting in CALIFORNIA MOXIE being checked away from BRIGHT MORTAR.  After the 300 Metres CALIFORNIA MOXIE, which had improved to the inside of BRIGHT MORTAR, was then checked when BRIGHT MORTAR was carried in by KINGDOM OF RICHES (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when giving ground.  Apprentice Wong was advised to exercise more care.  Jockey Chung was advised that he should ensure there is sufficient room for him to improve when taking runs.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have sustained an abrasion to the left front leg.

Shortly after the start became unbalanced when crowded between DRAGON FOUR SEAS and GIANT LEAP.  On returning back to the unsaddling stalls A Badel was dislodged but sustained no apparent injury in the incident.  Noted to have lost its right hind plate after the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running and near the 200 Metres shifted out and bumped THE REVOLUTION.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.
No report.

Leaving the 500 Metres was bumped and taken wider by LUCY IN THE SKY which shifted out to improve. Apprentice E C W Wong was reprimanded for using the whip on 2 consecutive strides near the 300 Metres.
Bumped shortly after the start.

M Chadwick reported that he was obliged to make use of his mount in the early stages to hold a forward position.  He said when unable to cross runners to his inside GOOD LUCK BABE was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly and then was bumped by FUN N FUN TOGETHER which shifted in.  Leaving the 500 Metres shifted out and made contact with WONDER KIT.

Lay out on the Home Turn.  When questioned L Hewitson stated that the instructions were to go forward. He said his mount was unsettled in the starting gates and for this reason jumped only fairly.  He said when GOOD LUCK BABE and MUST GO, which were drawn next to him, jumped better than his mount he elected to ride FATAL BLOW in a conservative manner in the early stages to avoid covering additional ground.  He added in the Home Straight his mount finished the race off only fairly and, in his opinion, would be better suited by returning to the turf and being stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Leaving the 200 Metres was hampered and taken wider when bumped by KEMPES which shifted out.

The performance of CAMP LAND, which finished tailed out on the second occasion in recent starts, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, CAMP LAND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in consecutive barrier trials and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

On jumping became unbalanced when crowded between SUPER JOY N FUN and WONDER KIT which shifted out.  H Bowman reported that his mount, which was having its first race start on the All Weather surface, resented the kickback and did not travel throughout the event.  He added that entering the Home Straight when not in a competitive position he discontinued in riding his mount out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of DRAGON FOUR SEAS, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, DRAGON FOUR SEAS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination. <31/10/2025 Additional Veterinary Reports>DRAGON FOUR SEAS, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings. DRAGON FOUR SEAS was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer K L Man this morning. He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg. As previously advised, DRAGON FOUR SEAS will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination before being allowed to race again.
On jumping shifted in and away from VICTORY SKY and bumped with EMBRACES.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 300 Metres shifted to the outside of EMBRACES to obtain clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 600 Metres raced tight to the inside of STURDY RUBY which lay in.

Bumped on jumping.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 550 Metres shifted out when being corrected by its rider C Y Ho and as a result made contact with NOBLE PURSUIT.
No report.
Near the 200 Metres H Doyle dropped her whip.
For some distance approaching the 150 Metres was held up for clear running behind EMBRACES which was giving ground.
Bumped on jumping.  Making the turn near the 1300 Metres raced tight between LOVERO which shifted in and TOP GUN which shifted out when it made the turn awkwardly.

Bumped at the start.  C L Chau reported that his mount did not appreciate racing to the inside of VICTORY SKY during the event and finished the race off in a one-paced manner in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped near the 550 Metres.

Y L Chung stated that his instructions were to go forward.  He  said in the early stages when a number of runners showed intent to hold an on-pace position and he was caught wide he elected to obtain a trailing position behind IVY LEAGUE.  He added when IVY LEAGUE was able to continue forward to obtain a position behind the leader near the 1200 Metres, LOVERO was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.

Jumped only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, TOP GUN will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

When questioned Apprentice E C W Wong stated that prior to the start being effected he looked behind to seek assistance from the starting gate handler and shortly after, the start was effected which resulted in him becoming badly unbalanced and KINGDOM OF RICHES jumping awkwardly.  Apprentice Wong was reminded of his obligations under Rule 103 to report any occurrence in a race that may affect the performance of his horse.  When questioned regarding his riding and in particular the fast early pace set, Apprentice Wong stated that whilst he was aware that the pace of the event was inside of standard time his mount was racing too keenly and despite his efforts to set a more sustainable pace KINGDOM OF RICHES did not respond to his efforts to do so.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of KINGDOM OF RICHES, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, KINGDOM OF RICHES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments. <6/11/2025 Additional Veterinary Report> KINGDOM OF RICHES, which performed poorly, was examined by the Veterinary Officer who said at that time there were no significant findings.  KINGDOM OF RICHES was again examined by the Veterinary Officer at the stables of Trainer C S Shum this morning.  He said at this time he noted the horse to be lame in its right front leg.  As previously advised, KINGDOM OF RICHES will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination which must include additional diagnostic assessments before being allowed to race again.
Bumped at the start.  Near the 350 Metres bumped with RUN RUN SUNRISE which lay out and away from JUMBO BLESSING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.

Over the final 300 Metres lay out under pressure and shifted ground towards the grandstand running rail.  C Y Ho reported that his mount was standing awkwardly in the starting gates and as a consequence jumped only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly, got its head up and then was checked when crowded between KA YING WARRIOR and MAGIC SUPER which shifted out.  Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up behind SO MY FOLKS.  Near the 250 Metres CIRCUS SPEED was then eased when crowded between SO MY FOLKS and STRAIGHT TO GLORY which shifted in slightly.
No report.
Over the final 350 Metres was held up for clear running and could not be tested to the finish of the event.
Near the 350 Metres shifted out and away from JUMBO BLESSING and was bumped.
Over the final 350 Metres was held up for clear running and could not be ridden out to the finish of the event.

Between the 500 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running behind STRAIGHT TO GLORY.  When questioned K De Melo stated that after following GIANT BALLON near the 250 Metres he observed GIANT BALLON shift in slightly and as a consequence he endeavoured to improve to that runner’s outside.  He said as he commenced to improve GIANT BALLON gave ground and shifted out slightly which resulted in WINNING MONEY having to be checked approaching the 200 Metres when unable to continue forward.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted out at the start and made heavy contact with CIRCUS SPEED.
Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped by CELESTIAL HARMONY which shifted in.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly and made contact with the right side of its starting gate.  Prior to declaring weighed-in the Stewards considered if there were sufficient grounds for a protest/objection against either MR GOOD VIBES being declared the winner or PANDA LEGEND being declared the second placegetter after both horses shifted ground near the finish of the event.  When the Stewards were satisfied that the crowding to GANGNAM STAR did not occur until passing the winning post they declined to lodge a protest/objection and weighed-in was declared on the numbers semaphored by the Judge.

Jumped awkwardly and then was crowded by ONLY U which shifted in abruptly.  From a wide barrier was then shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  When questioned K De Melo stated his instructions from a wide barrier were to ride the horse in a conservative manner in the early stages.  He said as a consequence HARRY’S HERO settled back in the field where it followed PANDA LEGEND during the race.  When questioned regarding his riding near the 500 Metres K De Melo stated that when PANDA LEGEND shifted out at this stage his mount, which was racing keenly, improved to the inside of PANDA LEGEND and therefore he elected to remain in this position with a view to following ONLY U and PERFECT PEACH into the race.  He added after shifting to the outside of ONLY U near the 400 Metres he commenced to ride his mount along but near the 300 Metres he was disappointed for clear running between MR GOOD VIBES and ONLY U when that runner shifted out, which resulted in HARRY’S HERO being held up for clear running between the 300 Metres and the 100 Metres.  After considering his explanation the Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey De Melo were reasonable in the circumstances.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 300 Metres was held up for clear running and was shifted to the outside of CELESTIAL HARMONY near the 300 Metres.
H T Mo was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 150 Metres.
Near the 350 Metres made contact with CELESTIAL HARMONY when improving into a narrow run between MR GOOD VIBES and CELESTIAL HARMONY.

A Badel reported that from a wide barrier and with blinkers being removed he was instructed to ride SUPREME WINNER in a conservative manner in the early stages.  Trainer C H Yip confirmed the instructions and advised he issued those instructions as SUPREME WINNER has not been finishing its races off when ridden in a forward position and had barrier trialed well on 14 October 2025 when ridden in a conservative manner in the early stages. A Badel was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion after the 200 Metres and again near the 100 Metres.
No report.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid THE CONCENTRATION.  M L Yeung pleaded guilty to a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see IRON LEGION).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Held up for clear running between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres.  Bumped near the 200 Metres. A Badel was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 170 Metres and again near the 150 Metres.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be suitable to race.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Near the 200 Metres was bumped by MY FLYING ANGEL which shifted out to improve.

Jumped awkwardly.  M L Yeung (KA YING POWER) pleaded guilty to a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of IRON LEGION, resulting in IRON LEGION having to be checked to avoid KA YING POWER, shifting in and also crowding the running of THE CONCENTRATION.  M L Yeung was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 19 November 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his neutral race riding record.  In addition, Jockey Yeung was fined $20,000.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

In the early stages raced keenly and for some distance near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from CIRCUIT FIERY.  Crowded near the 150 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 900 Metres became unbalanced when positioned tight to the inside of THE CONCENTRATION.  K C Leung reported that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses during the event.
No report.
Near the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied to avoid KA YING POWER.
L Ferraris stated that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Apprentice P N Wong stated that in the Home Straight she had some concerns with her mount’s action when it commenced to give ground.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

L Ferraris reported that his mount made a respiratory noise when giving ground over the concluding stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Over the final 150 Metres was held up behind MANYTHANKS FOREVER and could not be ridden out to the finish of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Approaching the 100 Metres was shifted to the inside of PERFECT PEACH to continue into clear running.

Jumped only fairly.   Z Purton could offer no excuse for the horse’s failure to run on in the Home Straight.  Trainer C W Chang stated that PERFECT PEACH had pleased him leading into today’s event but advised the horse was a little stirred up prior to the start of the race.  He added also, in his opinion, PERFECT PEACH does not appreciate racing in amongst other horses and this may have contributed to the horse’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of PERFECT PEACH was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, PERFECT PEACH will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   Sent for sampling post-race.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Bumped near the 350 Metres.  Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Withdrawn on 8.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen left hind) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter MANYTHANKS FOREVER.  Before being allowed to race again, LAPRAS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice after it was found to have a heart condition during the pre-race examination which required further assessment. Before being allowed to race again, DOUBLE SHOW will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Following further assessment of the heart condition, the Stewards will consider if any further action is taken against the horse.

Withdrawn on 8.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter BINGO BABE.  Before being allowed to race again, EURO ROCKS will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped near the 100 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  Near the 100 Metres lay out and made contact with THE AUSPICIOUS.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1100 Metres was steadied when HAPPY UNIVERSE (R Kingscote) shifted in when not quite clear. R Kingscote was advised to exercise more care. Near the 550 Metres was steadied when crowded between FLYING KNIGHT and TURF PHOENIX which shifted out and away from GALLANT EPOCH when it came under pressure.

Jumped awkwardly.  Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between INNO SUPER and AUDACIOUS PURSUIT, both of which shifted ground.  Near the 1100 Metres shifted out when being steadied to avoid THE LION KING.  Near the 500 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from BEAUTY MISSILE.  In the Home Straight lay out, raced greenly and proved difficult to ride.  Near the 150 Metres CHINA WIN became held up behind INNO SUPER and shifted out when being steadied to avoid INNO SUPER.

Raced wide and without cover from the 800 Metres.  Bumped near the 750 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, HAPPY UNIVERSE will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

On jumping was bumped by TURF PHOENIX which shifted out.  Z Purton reported that he was asked to ride the horse slightly more forward than its previous race starts.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to ride his mount forward to avoid covering additional ground.  He added once INNO SUPER obtained a position in the lead it lacked concentration and did not fully stretch out when racing in this position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Slow to begin.  Despite being ridden along in the early stages failed to show sufficient pace to hold a more forward position.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly and lost ground.
No report.
In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 1100 Metres got its head up when being steadied away from GLORIASTAR.
Held up between the 500 Metres and the 350 Metres.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  After being crossed by INNO SUPER leaving the 800 Metres attempted to obtain a position to that runner’s outside but was prevented from doing so when HAPPY UNIVERSE improved quickly to its outside.  As a result TURF PHOENIX and HAPPY UNIVERSE made contact near the 750 Metres.

M L Yeung advised that he was instructed to ride the horse in a forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea.  The performance of GOR GOR, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GOR GOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Withdrawn on 8.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left hind) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter GALLANT EPOCH.  Before being allowed to race again, VOLCANIC SPARK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Had difficulty obtaining clear running for some distance near the 300 Metres before being shifted to the inside of BOWSER where it obtained clear running at the 250 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shortly after the start raced tight to the inside of ETALON OR which shifted in.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  Raced keenly in the early stages and was steadied near the 900 Metres to avoid KYRUS TREASURE.  Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside to obtain clear running.

Near the 400 Metres was disappointed for clear running between ETALON OR and MOUNT EVEREST which shifted in slightly when preventing KYRUS TREASURE from shifting out.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when awkwardly placed close to ETALON OR which shifted out under riding.
Jumped awkwardly and then made contact with EXCEL WONGCHOY.  Held up for a short distance near the 400 Metres.

M L Yeung reported that his mount did not appear to appreciate racing amongst other runners in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped awkwardly and shifted out.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Making the Home Turn was held up for clear running.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Slow to begin.  Held up making the Home Turn.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Bumped on jumping.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
In the early stages got its head up and raced ungenerously.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  H Bowman stated that his mount failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight and was disappointing.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

Leaving the 500 Metres was hampered when being steadied to avoid CAP FERRAT which was giving ground.  C L Chau reported that the intention was to hold a more forward position but his mount was unable to do so despite his efforts.  He said making the Home Turn CHANCHENG GLORY lost momentum when being steadied to avoid CAP FERRAT and did not respond to his riding thereafter.

When questioned Z Purton stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position.  He said in the early stages from barrier 12 he was caught wide when a number of runners to his inside held their position.  He said when there was no opportunity to obtain cover he continued forward on CAP FERRAT to race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  He added that from the 600 Metres he became concerned there may be something amiss with his mount and for this reason making the Home Turn he retired it from the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils and also to be displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, CAP FERRAT will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Withdrawn on raceday morning by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame right fore).  Before being allowed to race again, CALIFORNIATOTALITY will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running. Over the concluding stages lay in, resulting in its rider H Doyle having to stop riding and straighten her mount. Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  K C Leung reported that the instructions were to hold a midfield position.  He said when his mount commenced reasonably well and was caught wide in the early stages he elected to continue forward to avoid covering additional ground.

Bumped near the 1000 Metres.  When questioned regarding his riding in the early stages and if there was an opportunity to maintain its position to the inside of SZERYNG, L Hewitson stated that he was instructed to endeavour to find cover on the horse and not to make too much use of his mount in the early stages to ensure that AWESOME TREASURE settled.  He said in the early stages when racing to the outside of MOTOMAN he was reluctant to continue forward and cross that runner as this would require him to make use of his mount contrary to the instructions issued.  He added leaving the 1000 Metres he was content to allow SZERYNG to cross his mount as he felt this would provide the horse a good opportunity to settle whilst at the same time being able to follow the favourite into the race.  Trainer D A Hayes confirmed the instructions issued.  The Stewards found the tactics adopted by Jockey Hewitson were reasonable in the circumstances.
Briefly held up for clear running near the 400 Metres.

Jumped only fairly.  After travelling a short distance then became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of JUBILANT WINNER which lay in.  L Ferraris reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages but responded only fairly to his riding over the concluding stages.

After travelling a short distance lay in and was bumped on the hindquarters.  After being shifted behind BRAVE WIN near the 900 Metres then shifted out making the first turn.   Near the 450 Metres was bumped and taken wider by BRAVE WIN.  A Atzeni stated that his mount travelled only fairly during the event and failed to respond to his riding when under pressure in the Home Straight.  Trainer J Richards advised that he had been satisfied with the horse in the lead up to today’s race which included a barrier trial conducted on 31 October 2025 when the horse performed well.  He said as the horse settled slightly further back in the field than he expected and was hampered on the Home Turn he was not too disappointed with its performance, particularly being up in weight today.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of JUBILANT WINNER was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, JUBILANT WINNER will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Near the 1000 Metres made contact with AWESOME TREASURE which was positioned tight to the inside of SZERYNG.

After travelling a short distance was bumped on the hindquarters and became unbalanced.  Near the 450 Metres shifted to the outside of GOOD CHAP to obtain clear running and made contact with JUBILANT WINNER.

When questioned Apprentice P N Wong stated that her mount jumped awkwardly and as a result became unbalanced.  She said afterwards she was of the opinion the horse may commence to buck and for this reason she did not ride it along shortly after the start.  She said when she was satisfied VIGOR ELLEEGANT was not going to react adversely to her riding she then elected to push it along in the early stages in an endeavour to try and hold a more competitive position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of mucus in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

H Bowman stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He said in the Home Straight his mount did not respond to his riding and he was of the opinion there may have been something amiss with it.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of GOOD CHAP, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, GOOD CHAP will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Approaching the first turn near the 900 Metres raced keenly and got its head up when being eased to obtain a position with cover behind PRAY FOR JUSTICE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the final 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of LUCY IN THE SKY when improving to the inside of that runner.
No report.
No report.

B Avdulla reported that he was instructed not to make too much use of the horse in the early stages to ensure it was able to finish the race off strongly in the Home Straight.  He said when JUNEAU PRIDE jumped only fairly it did  not show early pace, particularly with the hood being applied for the first time and as a result he elected to ride JUNEAU PRIDE conservatively in the early stages.  Trainer J Size confirmed the instructions issued.

In the middle stages raced keenly and near the 900 Metres was steadied away from NOVA KNIGHT.  C Y  Ho reported that his mount was out-paced in the early stages but responded reasonably well to his riding in the Home Straight and he recommended that the horse should be stepped up in distance for its next race start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Jumped awkwardly.  Over the final 200 Metres hung in under pressure and proved difficult to ride out to the finish of the race.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres was badly held up for clear running behind ETERNAL RICHNESS.  Sent for sampling post-race.

In the Home Straight lay in and proved difficult to ride out.  Near the 100 Metres made contact with the running rail.  L Ferraris was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on one occasion near the 75 Metres. Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 500 Metres was bumped.  Bumped near the 100 Metres.
Jumped awkwardly.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid CALIFORNIA BLUES.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running.
Near the 100 Metres made contact with MATTERS MOST when racing tight to the inside of that runner.

H Bowman advised that his mount, which was racing first up today, made ground in the early stages of the Home Straight but its run peaked near the 100 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped shortly after the start.  Near the 900 Metres made contact with ETERNAL RICHNESS when racing tight to the inside of that runner.
After travelling a short distance made contact with ETERNAL RICHNESS which shifted in.  Near the 1000 Metres was steadied away from CALIFORNIA BLUES.
Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be suitable to race.  Bumped shortly after the start.

Leaving the 1000 Metres BIGTIME GENERATION shifted to the outside of MATTERS MOST when being crossed by that runner, resulting in OTOKOMAE being taken wider and CALIFORNIA BLUES then being eased when awkwardly placed close to the heels of OTOKOMAE.

After travelling a short distance was bumped.  Bumped near the 900 Metres.  Near the 500 Metres made contact with MATTERS MOST when that runner shifted out to improve to the outside of INFINITE RESOLVE.  H Doyle reported that her mount, which was having its first race start in Hong Kong, raced greenly throughout the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Bumped on jumping.  H Bentley stated that when caught wide in the early stages he elected to continue forward to race outside the lead to avoid covering additional ground.  He added that in the Home Straight his mount was unable to finish the race off due to the efforts in the early stages.

Bumped shortly after the start.  C Y Ho reported that his mount travelled satisfactorily in the early stages but on entering the Home Straight became unbalanced, made contact with KYRUS TREASURE and did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.

The performance of MASSIVE FIRE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, MASSIVE FIRE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.   A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

Apprentice E C W Wong reported that his mount raced keenly during the race and near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid ANODE.  He said as a result PANACEA was obliged to race wide and without cover thereafter.
No report.

Near the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid LITTLE PARADISE.  R Kingscote reported that his mount raced keenly during the race and was obliged to race wide and without cover from the 900 Metres before giving ground in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Began only fairly.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when positioned close to LIGHT YEARS CHARM.

When questioned regarding his riding Y L Chung explained that his instructions were to lead the event but if the pace was too fast he was given the option to obtain a position with cover behind the lead.  He said in the early stages he rode his mount along to attempt to lead the race and when positioned slightly behind DROMBEG BANNER in the early stages he continued to encourage his mount forward to hold the lead.  He said after improving into the lead to the inside of DROMBEG BANNER near the 1100 Metres BEAUTY CRESCENT then commenced to race keenly when DROMBEG BANNER was positioned to his outside.  He added that this resulted in the pace of the event during the early and middle stages of the race being run inside of standard time.  After considering his explanation the Stewards advised Jockey Chung that he had made an error of judgement in the early stages by continuing to endeavour to maintain the lead when the pace of the event was being run inside of standard time and in the circumstances he should have allowed DROMBEG BANNER to cross his mount and take advantage of the option to obtain a position with cover behind that runner.
Over the concluding stages made contact with DROMBEG BANNER due to both runners shifting ground.

Over the concluding stages made contact with STEPS AHEAD due to both runners shifting ground.  When questioned H Doyle stated that her instructions were to endeavour to lead the race and find the rail as DROMBEG BANNER performs best in this position.  She said after commencing well and riding her mount along, when positioned to the outside and in advance of BEAUTY CRESCENT, she continued to ride her mount forward with a view to crossing BEAUTY CRESCENT in compliance with her instructions.  She said when BEAUTY CRESCENT maintained the position to her inside and she was not clear to cross that runner she then near the 1000 Metres restrained her mount to take a position to the outside of BEAUTY CRESCENT.  She added as a result of the tactics she adopted in the early stages the race was run inside of standard time through that section of the race.  When questioned regarding her riding from the 450 Metres and if there was an opportunity to ride her mount more patiently, given the fast early pace, Jockey Doyle stated that making the turn DROMBEG BANNER did not travel well and for this reason near the 450 Metres she commenced to ride her mount along to make up ground on BEAUTY CRESCENT and after initially responding to her riding the horse’s run ended near the 100 Metres.  After considering her explanation, whilst the Stewards found the tactics she adopted in the early stages were reasonable, she was advised that in the circumstances she made an error of judgement from the 450 Metres by placing her mount under pressure too soon, particularly having regard to the early and middle stages of the event being run inside of standard time.  Trainer P C Ng confirmed the instructions issued.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start. Near the 300 Metres C L Chau dropped his left rein for a short distance.
B Avdulla reported that along the Back Straight his mount became unbalanced when it appeared to jump a shadow on the track near the 1100 Metres.
Slow to begin.
Jumped awkwardly.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.

Jumped only fairly.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  M L Yeung was warned in relation to using his whip in a manner where the hand holding the whip was above shoulder height on a number of occasions in the Home Straight.  When questioned regarding the improved performance of the horse Trainer K H Ting stated that the horse, which was having its first race start for his stable had settled well after being transferred.  He said, in his opinion, TEAM TEAM FOLKS was aided by the sheepskin cheek pieces being removed for tonight’s race and had pleased him leading into the race with two barrier trials, in particular its most recent trial on 18 October 2025.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped only fairly.  Shortly after the start was steadied when crowded between MASTER PHOENIX which shifted out slightly and KING GLORIOSO which shifted in.  Approaching the 700 Metres commenced to race keenly and was checked to avoid ALABAMA SONG. As a consequence ROBOT LUCKY STAR was shifted to the outside of ALABAMA SONG where it was forced to race wide and without cover thereafter.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out in the Home Straight.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then was badly crowded for room between MASTER PHOENIX which shifted in slightly and MULTIDUTCH which shifted out abruptly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Jumped only fairly. Near the 150 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between ALABAMA SONG which was giving ground and STAR FIGURE which shifted in.
Shifted in on jumping and made contact with STAR FIGURE.  Noted to have lost its right front plate after the race.

After travelling a short distance made contact with ALABAMA SONG due to both runners shifting ground. Near the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid SILVER SPURS (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not clear.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded and advised he must ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  Throughout the early and middle stages raced keenly and got its head up for some distance near the 800 Metres when being crossed by MEGA BONUS.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out abruptly at the start and bumped with MASTER PHOENIX when being corrected by its rider.  In the early stages became unbalanced when racing tight to the inside of ROBOT LUCKY STAR and behind KING GLORIOSO.  Crowded near the 100 Metres.  Approaching the winning post MULTIDUTCH was again crowded by ALABAMA SONG which was racing tight to the inside of CIRCUIT GOGO.  M Chadwick reported that the intention was to hold a more forward position but after his mount shifted out abruptly at the start he was unable to do so.
Lay out under pressure in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 1500 Metres was steadied to avoid RAGGA BOMB when being shifted in across that runner to obtain cover.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Jumped awkwardly.  Bumped shortly after the start.  In the early stages raced keenly.  Over the concluding stages raced tight between BULL ATTITUDE which lay in and AMAZING GAZE which shifted out when improving to the outside of BEAUTY GLORY, resulting in AMAZING GAZE and AEROINVINCIBLE making contact.

Between the 250 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running.  After improving to the inside of AEROINVINCIBLE passing the 150 Metres then raced tight between AEROINVINCIBLE and BEAUTY GLORY which shifted out slightly, resulting in AMAZING GAZE making contact with AEROINVINCIBLE and not being able to be ridden out to the finish of the event.
Over the final 150 Metres could not be fully tested when positioned close to BEAUTY GLORY.

Shortly after the start was bumped by AEROINVINCIBLE which was taken in by RAGGA BOMB.  Near the 1100 Metres shifted out towards CALIFORNIA BANNER when racing keenly and as a result was steadied.  Between the 350 Metres and the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when attempting to shift to the outside of BEAUTY GLORY.  K C Leung reported that it was not the intention to hold a forward position but as his mount has a tendency to be slow to begin, he ensured that it jumped well tonight and this resulted in the horse holding a more forward position than expected.

Jumped only fairly.  Shifted out near the 300 Metres and made contact with RAGGA BOMB.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running between the 300 Metres and the 250 Metres when positioned behind AEROINVINCIBLE. Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres raced tight between RAGGA BOMB and AMAZING GAZE.
Over the concluding stages was bumped by APOLAR FIGHTER which shifted in under pressure.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in under pressure over the concluding stages and made contact with LUCKY BLESSING.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Between the 300 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running when being shifted to the outside of APOLAR FIGHTER.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in at the start and bumped with SILVER KING.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  M L Yeung reported that over the concluding stages he was unable to fully test his mount when racing tight to the inside of LUCKY BLESSING.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  K De Melo reported that his mount hung in in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.
No report.
No report.
After travelling a short distance shifted out and made contact with MAJESTIC DELIGHT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped on jumping and then after travelling a short distance became unbalanced when it again bumped with MAJESTIC DELIGHT.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  In the Home Straight hung in and for some distance approaching the 200 Metres proved reluctant to shift to the outside of TALENTS SUPREMO.
Jumped awkwardly.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when positioned close to RIDING HIGH.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with GOOD PROSPECT.  In the early stages raced ungenerously and got its head up.  For some distance near the 1000 Metres HAPPY BOYS became unbalanced when its rider L Hewitson was endeavouring to obtain a position with cover behind CHILL MASTER.  HAPPY BOYS then refused to settle in the middle stages and continued to race ungenerously.  For a short distance near the 250 Metres had difficulty obtaining clear running when being shifted to the outside of GOOD PROSPECT.

Near the 900 Metres was bumped by NOBLE DELUXE which shifted in and away from BEAUTY FORMULA, resulting in TALENTS SUPREMO then racing keenly when being steadied to avoid MAJESTIC DELIGHT.  Over the concluding stages lay in and away from GOOD PROSPECT and as a consequence could not be fully tested to the finish of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.

On jumping shifted out, made contact with RIDING HIGH and became unbalanced.  After travelling a short distance MAJESTIC DELIGHT was then steadied when crowded between DOUBLE BINGO which shifted out slightly and RIDING HIGH which shifted in after being bumped by MAJESTIC DELIGHT.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 900 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being steadied to avoid GOOD PROSPECT.  RICH HORSE continued to race keenly in the middle stages.

Apprentice E C W Wong could offer no excuse for his mount’s failure to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Y L Chung reported that his mount was obliged to race very wide and without cover until near the 600 Metres but was disappointing in its failure to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

J McDonald reported that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  He added despite the wide run NOBLE DELUXE gave ground quickly in the Home Straight and he felt there may be something amiss with the horse.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of NOBLE DELUXE, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, NOBLE DELUXE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Bounded on jumping.  Lay in over the final 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Near the 50 Metres made contact with EVERSTAR due to both runners shifting ground slightly.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Raced keenly in the early stages and hung out making the first turn.  Near the 800 Metres was steadied away from KING OBERON.  Near the 50 Metres made contact with CALIFORNIA BAY due to both runners shifting ground slightly.
Lay in in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.  Over the concluding stages could not be fully ridden out when racing tight to the inside of PEJIBAYE.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Near the 800 Metres was steadied to avoid CALIFORNIA BAY.

A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  As this was the second occasion that LOOKS OUTSTANDING had bled, the horse is permanently barred from any further racing.
No report.
Slow to begin.
On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by CALIFORNIA BAY which shifted out.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Leaving the 900 Metres was steadied to avoid PEJIBAYE (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in when not clear.  Apprentice Wong was reprimanded.

Withdrawn on 11.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (swollen right fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter WATCH THIS ONE.  Before being allowed to race again, GLORIOUS KINGDOM will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

After travelling a short distance made contact with LEAN MASTER due to both runners shifting ground.  For some distance approaching the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid LEAN MASTER.  Near the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of STAR FIGURE and as a consequence made contact with MULTIDUTCH.  Raced tight over the concluding stages.  B Avdulla stated that his mount, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley and is still inexperienced, was not entirely comfortable racing around the Happy Valley circuit and would derive benefit from tonight’s experience.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.  Raced wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres.  Near the 700 Metres was hampered when taken wider by ROBOT LUCKY STAR.
Jumped only fairly.  Held up for clear running on the Home Turn.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay in over the final 200 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
Leaving the 1000 Metres was steadied to avoid GAMEPLAYER ELITE (H Doyle) which shifted in when not clear.  H Doyle was advised to exercise more care.

Near the 500 Metres was steadied to avoid TURIN WARRIOR when THESIS improved quickly to its outside.  J McDonald reported that from a wide barrier he was instructed to ride his mount conservatively in the early stages.  Assistant Trainer P H Lo confirmed the instructions issued.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly.

Near the 1400 Metres SETANTA, which was being steadied to obtain a position behind CAN’T GO WONG, was checked when crowded between CAN’T GO WONG and GAMEPLAYER ELITE (H Doyle) which, after shifting in and away from GLORIOUS RYDER (L Hewitson), was then taken in by that runner, resulting in GAMEPLAYER ELITE having to be steadied.  L Hewitson was reprimanded and advised he must ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  H Doyle was reprimanded and advised in similar circumstances she would be expected to make a greater effort to prevent her mounts from shifting ground when not clear to do so.

Steadied near the 1400 Metres.  Hung in throughout the event and proved difficult to ride out in the Home Straight.  H Doyle stated that the intention was to hold a handy position.  She said when caught wide in the early stages she was obliged to continue forward to cross TAKE ACTION and this resulted in her mount obtaining a more forward position than she had been instructed to do.
H Bowman could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
No report.

Noted to have blood in the mouth on arrival at the Start.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and found to be suitable to race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Shifted out at the start and bumped BULL ATTITUDE.  Near the 300 Metres was bumped by LESLIE when that runner shifted out, resulting in RAGGA BOMB then racing in restricted room between BULL ATTITUDE and LESLIE for a short distance thereafter.  Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres raced tight between BULL ATTITUDE which lay in and LESLIE which was racing tight to the outside of AMAZING GAZE.
No report.

Shifted out on jumping and bumped DR GOLDEN GENERAL.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race revealed that the horse was displaying an irregular heart rhythm.  Before being allowed to race again, FORERUNNER will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Jumped only fairly and was bumped shortly after the start.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped on jumping.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Jumped only fairly and then bumped with PERFECTO MOMENTS which shifted out.  L Ferraris stated that after enjoying a good run during the race HANDSOME BOMB was disappointing in that it failed to respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  He added that when he felt there may be something amiss with the horse he did not fully ride it out to the finish of the event.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  Before being allowed to race again, HANDSOME BOMB will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Y L Chung stated that he was instructed to settle his mount where comfortable.  He said after his mount commenced well he held an on-pace position in the early stages but when unable to cross runners to his inside HANDSOME BLOND was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and hung out during the race.  He further stated that as a consequence HANDSOME BLOND was unable to finish the race off in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of HANDSOME BLOND, which finished tailed out, was considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, HANDSOME BLOND will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.

Leaving the 1100 Metres was eased to avoid KING MILES which shifted in and away from FUN ELITE despite the efforts of its rider.  Leaving the 300 Metres lay in and as a result made contact with SUPERB BOY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and bumped FUN ELITE.  Lay in in the Home Straight, resulting in its rider H Bowman changing his whip through to his right hand near the 150 Metres.

After travelling a short distance made contact with NOT USUAL PICK which was taken out.  After being held up for clear running in the early stages of the Home Straight was then steadied when disappointed between FUN ELITE and SUPERB BOY.  As a result FIND MY LOVE did not obtain clear running until near the 200 Metres.
Bumped at the start.   Lay in in the Home Straight.

Bumped at the start.  Apprentice P N Wong stated that from a wide barrier she had to make some use of her mount in the early stages to cross runners to her inside. She said as a result FUN ELITE, which was racing first up, did not finish the race off and would derive a fitness benefit from tonight’s race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped leaving the 300 Metres.  L Hewitson could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  Bumped after travelling a short distance.  Lay in on the first turn after being crossed by YOUNG EMPEROR.
Slow to begin.  Approaching the 1000 Metres NOT USUAL PICK lay in towards ORIGIN OF FORM, resulting in ORIGIN OF FORM racing tight to the inside of that runner for a short distance.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Blundered shortly after the start.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out shortly after the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Made contact with a rail in the Parade Ring, resulting in its rider R Kingscote being dislodged.  Was examined on arrival at the Start and found to be suitable to race.  From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Briefly held up on the Home Turn.
Shortly after the start was bumped by SKY VINO which shifted out.  Approaching the winning post raced tight between SKY VINO and EXCELLENCE VALUE.  Sent for sampling post-race.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.
Shifted in at the start and bumped ROMANTIC LAOS.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

Bumped on jumping.  C L Chau stated that his mount was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event and as a consequence was left without a finishing effort in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Attempted to buck after leaving the Parade Ring, resulting in L Hewitson being dislodged and the horse galloping a considerable distance before being recaptured.  Acting on veterinary advice that CHARITY GAIN was not suitable to race, the horse was withdrawn by order of the Stewards.  Before being allowed to race again, CHARITY GAIN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.  Subsequently L Hewitson was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his remaining race riding engagement.

Withdrawn on 10.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (right front tendon injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter NOBLE PURSUIT.  Before being allowed to race again, FLAMINGO TRILLION will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
For a short distance leaving the 100 Metres raced in restricted room between SKY HEART and HUGE WAVE, both of which shifted ground slightly.
No report.
From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Leaving the 600 Metres was steadied to avoid TAJ DRAGON when that runner gave ground quickly when it went amiss.

Had its left front plate adjusted in the saddling stalls.  Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Jumped only fairly.  Lay in in the Home Straight.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

H Bowman stated that his instructions were to lead if possible.  He said when TELECOM FIGHTERS held the lead and its rider showed intent on maintaining that position he elected to settle on its outside.  He added when the pace of the event steadied in the middle stages his mount was disadvantaged as it was unable to respond to his riding when the pace increased after the 500 Metres.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Slow to begin and then was crowded between SING DRAGON and TELECOM FIGHTERS, both of which shifted ground.  H Doyle reported that her mount, which was having its first race start at Happy Valley, did not appreciate racing on the circuit.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea.  Before being allowed to race again, MARKWIN will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.

H T Mo stated that when pressured by GUSTOSISIMO from the 500 Metres his mount came under pressure and gave ground thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.   Went amiss leaving the 600 Metres when it sustained an injury to its right front leg.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be lame in its right front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, TAJ DRAGON will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Briefly held up on the Home Turn.  Between the 400 Metres and the 250 Metres was again held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
On jumping was bumped by GEORGIAN SIGMA which shifted in abruptly.  Shifted in near the 350 Metres and was bumped.
Shifted in abruptly at the start and was bumped.  Near the 900 Metres made contact with RUBY THRIVE when that runner shifted out slightly.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Had its right front plate adjusted in the saddling stalls. Was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Approaching the 900 Metres ELITE GOLF was being steadied to take up a position behind SALON S.  When being steadied, RUBY THRIVE, which was racing greenly, shifted in abruptly after making contact with GEORGIAN SIGMA, resulting in ELITE GOLF then having to be steadied when crowded by RUBY THRIVE.  The Stewards were satisfied that the principal reason for the incident was due to the racing manners of RUBY THRIVE, however, Z Purton, rider of GEORGIAN SIGMA, was advised to ensure that he leaves sufficient racing room for runners to his inside.  Had difficulty obtaining clear running approaching the 300 Metres.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Lay out over the concluding stages.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Bumped at the start.  Held up making the Home Turn and near the 400 Metres was shifted to the outside of WINNING DATA to obtain clear running.

K Teetan stated that whilst the intention was to hold a forward position he had not expected to lead.  He said when CALIFORNIA DEEPLY, which was positioned to his inside, did not continue forward, TOP PEAK held the lead without being pressured to do so.
Lay out making the Home Turn.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
On jumping made contact with OLDTOWN and then shortly after became unbalanced when it shifted in and made contact with POWER SUMMIT.
L Ferraris reported that from the outside barrier his instructions were to ride his mount in a conservative manner in the early stages, particularly with it stepping up to 1400 Metres.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  Raced keenly throughout the early and middle stages and hung in.  Shifted out leaving the 500 Metres and was bumped.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded by AEROVOLANIC which shifted out.
Bumped shortly after the start.  D Probert confirmed that from a wide barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position and similar to when it barrier trialed successfully on 24 October 2025.

Bumped at the start.  Near the 1100 Metres raced in restricted room between COME FAST FAY FAY and ALL ROUND WINNER.  Leaving the 500 Metres was bumped and taken wider by COME FAST FAY FAY.  H Doyle stated that after being bumped and taken wider on the Home Turn her mount did not finish the race off thereafter.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Shifted in at the start and was bumped.

On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by LIGHT YEARS GLORY which shifted in.  Raced very wide and without cover until near the 700 Metres.  When questioned C L Chau stated that the intention was to hold a midfield position with cover.  He said in the early stages when caught wide and to the outside of TURIN CHAMPIONS he elected to come back to obtain a position with cover behind that runner which resulted in his mount settling further back in the field than he had expected.  He said when being shifted behind TURIN CHAMPIONS leaving the 800 Metres he was of the opinion that the pace of the race increased and this resulted in his mount losing touch with the field thereafter.  He added from the 600 Metres he encouraged his mount forward, however, it took some time to respond to his riding and was inclined to lay out making the Home Turn before finishing the race off well in the Home Straight.

On jumping was bumped by TURIN CHAMPIONS which shifted in.  Near the 350 Metres was steadied when crowded between COOL BOY (J Orman) which shifted in slightly and LIGHT YEARS GLORY (M Chadwick) which shifted out when being corrected by its rider.  Both J Orman and M Chadwick were advised to exercise more care.

On jumping was bumped by SALON S which shifted in.  Near the 850 Metres lay out towards FOREVER FANCY, became unbalanced and blundered.  For some distance near the 200 Metres raced tight to the inside of ELITE GOLF when attempting to improve inside that runner.  WORD OF KINDNESS was then shifted to the outside of ELITE GOLF near the 100 Metres where it obtained clear running.

Near the 1000 Metres was steadied when momentarily crowded by WORD OF KINDNESS which was taken in by FOREVER FANCY when that runner shifted in when being steadied to allow RUBY THRIVE to cross.  Making the first turn leaving the 900 Metres was steadied away from JOLLY BRILLIANT.
Making the first turn lay out and was steadied to avoid WORD OF KINDNESS.  Near the 250 Metres was steadied to avoid RUBY THRIVE which shifted out and away from SUPER DRAGON.

Shifted in at the start and was bumped.  Shifted out near the 350 Metres when being corrected and was bumped.  M Chadwick reported that from the outside barrier he was instructed to take up a forward position and attempt to follow GEORGIAN SIGMA across.  He said when his mount did not show sufficient pace to cross RUBY THRIVE it was obliged to race wide and without cover for the majority of the event where it hung in during the race.  Trainer W K Mo confirmed the instructions issued.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped only fairly.

On jumping made contact with the right side of its starting gate.  C Y Ho reported that his mount,  which was having its first race start, raced ungenerously throughout the event and near the 900 Metres became unbalanced and was checked when positioned to the inside of GEORGIAN SIGMA.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The racing manners and performance of RUBY THRIVE were considered unacceptable.  Before being allowed to race again, RUBY THRIVE will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Slow to begin.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted out at the start and made contact with KINGLY DEMEANOR.
No report.
Shifted in abruptly at the start, made contact with ILLUMINOUS and became unbalanced when being corrected by its rider.
No report.
Briefly held up near the 400 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Jumped only fairly.  K C Leung reported that his mount did not appreciate racing in amongst other horses and did not respond to his riding in the Home Straight.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer”.
No report.
Bumped at the start.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Slow to begin.

On jumping became unbalanced when bumped by CHARITY TOGETHER which shifted in abruptly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to have bled from both nostrils.  Before being allowed to race again, ILLUMINOUS will be required to perform satisfactorily in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Near the 500 Metres made contact with SMART TRIO.  Sent for sampling post-race.

Near the 1400 Metres, when racing keenly, was steadied to avoid WAH MAY WAI WAI (H Bowman) which shifted in when not quite clear.  H Bowman was advised to ensure that he is sufficiently clear when shifting ground.  When questioned L Hewitson stated that the instructions were to hold an on-pace position but he was to ensure that the horse obtained cover.  He said in the early stages when being crossed by WAH MAY WAI WAI his mount commenced to race keenly and did not settle for some distance thereafter.  He stated that after being crossed by WAH MAY WAI WAI, NINJA DERBY settled further back in the field than expected when that runner did not continue forward.  He added that in retrospect he would have been better suited by allowing his mount to continue forward in the early stages to obtain a position on the rail in advance of HARRY’S HERO.  When questioned regarding his riding in the Home Straight L Hewitson stated that after being positioned behind WAH MAY WAI WAI he endeavoured then to improve between WAH MAY WAI WAI and JOLLY JUMPER, however, between the 400 Metres and the 300 Metres he did not fully commit to the position as he was concerned that both those runners may shift ground and that run would close.  He said once he was satisfied there was clear running available he was able to place his mount under full pressure near the 300 Metres where it finished the race off well although over the concluding stages it lay out, resulting in him having to stop riding and straighten his mount for a short distance.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with CELESTIAL HARMONY.
No report.
No report.

J McDonald stated that the intention was to hold a more forward position but despite riding his mount along in the early stages it did not show sufficient pace to do so.  He added when under pressure in the Home Straight ROSEWOOD FLEETFOOT finished the race off in a one-paced manner.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Made contact with the right side of its starting gate on jumping.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Making the first turn was taken wider by COOL BLUE which shifted out to improve.  Near the 500 Metres COOL BLUE and SMART TRIO made contact.

Near the 150 Metres was steadied when disappointed for clear running between JOLLY JUMPER and CELESTIAL HARMONY, both of which shifted ground.  CHATEAU LE PECHE was then shifted to the outside of JOLLY JUMPER where it had some difficulty obtaining clear running thereafter when positioned behind CELESTIAL PATCH.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event and raced keenly.
Bumped at the start.
No report.
Slow to begin.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Shifted in on jumping and was bumped.  A Badel was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference approaching the 200 Metres (see CHICKEN DINNER).  Sent for sampling post-race.
Jumped only fairly and then was crowded between SPARKLING FELLOW and CHICKEN DINNER, both of which shifted ground.  Near the 700 Metres was crowded by DANICA’S CHOICE.
No report.
Over the final 300 Metres lay in and as result shifted away from the stand side rail.
Near the 250 Metres was steadied and shifted to the inside of E HO HO to obtain clear running.

Bumped near the 350 Metres.  Z Purton reported that his mount travelled well during the early stages but when asked for an effort near the 250 Metres the horse’s action changed and he felt there may have been something amiss with it thereafter.  Trainer C W Chang stated that the horse was disadvantaged drawing barrier 1 and Jockey Purton  having to make use of it  in the early stages to hold a forward position.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.  The performance of CASA OF HONOR was considered disappointing as compared to its previous race starts.  Before being allowed to race again, CASA OF HONOR will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial and be subjected to an official veterinary examination.

Shifted out on jumping and was bumped.  A Badel (SPARKLING FELLOW) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that approaching the 200 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of CHICKEN DINNER, resulting in CHICKEN DINNER having to be checked to avoid SPARKLING FELLOW.  A Badel was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 3 December 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 2 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his very good race riding record.
Jumped awkwardly.  Bumped leaving the 600 Metres.
Near the 350 Metres shifted in and away from CRIMSON FLASH and made contact with CASA OF HONOR.
Leaving the 600 Metres shifted in and bumped with PEGAS.

Jumped only fairly.  Near the 700 Metres was checked when briefly crowded by SPARKLING FELLOW (A Badel) which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.  A Badel was advised to exercise more care.  In assessing the incident the Stewards took into consideration that DANICA’S CHOICE had reacted adversely when K C Leung took a hold of his mount.

Jumped only fairly.  B Avdulla reported that on jumping his right foot was dislodged from his stirrup for a short distance before he was able to reposition it.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Jumped awkwardly and blundered badly when its left hind leg made contact with its left front leg, resulting in its rider J McDonald being dislodged.  Subsequently J McDonald was examined by the Chief Medical Officer and passed fit to fulfil his subsequent race riding engagements.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
