No report.
Hung in in the Home Straight and proved difficult to ride out.  A warning was placed on the racing manners of LOCH TAY.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Leaving the 200 Metres shifted out slightly and was bumped on the hindquarters by PRECISION GOAL which was taken in.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

As the start was effected DREAMING WINNER shifted out abruptly, resulting in its rider M F Poon being dislodged.  DREAMING WINNER then proceeded to gallop riderless back behind the starting gates in the opposite direction to the field.  When the Stewards were unable to be satisfied that DREAMING WINNER could be recaptured, on the grounds of safety, they abandoned the race when the field reached the 500 Metres.  Under the provisions of Rule 12(40) the race was subsequently declared void. Before being allowed to race again, Dreaming Winner will be required to perform to the satisfaction of the Stewards in a barrier trial, starting from the outside barrier.

Withdrawn on 13.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (right front tendon injury) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter GOLDEN DREAM.  Before being allowed to race again, HE WAS YOU will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Jumped only fairly.
Jumped awkwardly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.

Passing the 200 Metres was checked when crowded by LOCH TAY (R Kingscote) which hung in despite the efforts of its rider.  As a result GOOD LUCK BABE was taken in and made heavy contact with PRECISION GOAL.  The Stewards found that LOCH TAY was hanging in during this incident and were of the opinion that Jockey Kingscote had made significant endeavour to prevent the horse from shifting in.  However, he was severely reprimanded and advised that in similar circumstances he would be expected to stop riding and straighten his mounts when they shift ground.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Jumped awkwardly.
Badly crowded leaving the 200 Metres.
Bumped at the start.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
No report.
Shifted out at the start and bumped with ARIEL.  Raced keenly in the early stages and for some distance near the 1200 Metres was steadied away from RELIABLE PROFIT.
No report.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.

Shortly after the start was crowded between PRESTIGE GOOD and ANOTHER WORLD which shifted in and away from MORGAN SUCCESS.  Lay in in the Home Straight, resulting in its rider K Teetan correcting his mount approaching the 50 Metres.
Bumped shortly after the start.

Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  C Y Ho stated that the intention was to hold an on-pace position.  He said when caught wide in the early stages he elected to continue forward to cross runners to his inside to avoid covering additional ground.

Bumped shortly after the start.  C L Chau was found guilty of a careless riding charge for causing interference near the 150 Metres (see WINNING GOLD).  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
On jumping was crowded by WINNING GOLD which shifted out.

Near the 400 Metres was held up for clear running before being shifted to the inside of LEGENDARY YEARS to obtain clear running.  Between the 200 Metres and the 100 Metres raced tight to the inside of ANOTHER WORLD.  H Bowman reported that the intention was to be more forward but after his mount commenced only fairly and then was crowded to the inside of BEAUTY BOLT it then settled further back in the field than intended.

On jumping shifted out and made contact with MISTER DAPPER, resulting in SPIRIT OF PEACE shifting in and making contact with POPE CODY soon after.  Between the 450 Metres and the 200 Metres was held up for clear running.
Near the 1200 Metres commenced to race keenly and was checked to avoid PRESTIGE GOOD.
Leaving the 400 Metres was briefly held up for clear running behind BEAUTY BOLT.  Near the 250 Metres was momentarily crowded by POPE CODY which shifted in.

Shifted out at the start and was bumped.  C L Chau (PRESTIGE GOOD) was found guilty of a charge of careless riding [Rule 100(1)] in that near the 150 Metres he allowed his mount to shift in when not clear of WINNING GOLD, resulting in WINNING GOLD having to be checked to avoid PRESTIGE GOOD.  C L Chau was suspended from riding in races for one Hong Kong raceday to be conducted on Wednesday, 3 December 2025 at Happy Valley.  In assessing penalty, the Stewards determined the carelessness grade 1 and the consequences grade 2 and also considered his good race riding record.

L Ferraris advised that his mount made a respiratory noise during the running of the race.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race found that horse to be a "roarer” which had previously been reported.

Withdrawn on 14.11.25 by order of the Stewards acting on veterinary advice (lame left fore) and replaced by Standby Declared Starter ANOTHER WORLD.  Before being allowed to race again, FLYING LUCK will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 450 Metres and the 350 Metres was held up for clear running.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Sent for sampling post-race.
Bumped leaving the 900 Metres.  Sent for sampling post-race.
Raced keenly in the middle stages and for some distance near the 700 Metres was steadied to avoid CALL ME GLORIOUS.
Near the 100 Metres was hampered when crowded between INVINCIBLE SHIELD and LADY’S CHOICE which shifted out before being corrected by its rider.

From the outside barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  Between the 300 Metres and the 150 Metres was held up for clear running and passing the 150 Metres was shifted to the outside of DANCING CODE to obtain clear running.
No report.

From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.  K Teetan reported that leaving the 600 Metres his mount commenced to race fiercely and as a consequence he was obliged to check STORM RIDER when positioned close to the heels of MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE.  In this incident STORM RIDER shifted out and made contact with GORGEOUS WIN.
Bumped near the 900 Metres.
A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Sent for sampling post-race.

In the Home Straight lay out and near the 200 Metres M L Yeung was obliged to stop riding and straighten his mount.  SIGHT DREAMER then continued to lay out over the final 200 Metres and made contact with CALIFORNIA STAR near the 50 Metres.
Shifted in shortly after the start and was bumped.  When placed under pressure approaching the 150 Metres lay out, resulting in its rider K Teetan having to stop riding and straighten his mount.

Jumped awkwardly, shifted in and made contact with MR COOL.  Leaving the 1500 Metres was checked when crowded between MR COOL which shifted out making the turn and FASHION LEGEND (Apprentice E C W Wong) which shifted in.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded.  Approaching the 1400 Metres was crowded between SHANGHAI STYLE and MR COOL which shifted out after being steadied.  Sent for sampling post-race.
No report.
Near the 550 Metres was hampered when taken wider by CALIFORNIA STAR.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.
Bumped at the start.  Noted to have lost its left front plate after the race.
Was fractious in the saddling stalls, was examined by the Veterinary Officer and passed suitable to race.  Between the 350 Metres and the 200 Metres was badly held up for clear running.

Bumped at the start.  Approaching the 1400 Metres was steadied to avoid FASHION LEGEND (Apprentice E C W Wong) when that runner shifted in whilst not clear.  Apprentice Wong was severely reprimanded.  A Atzeni stated that he could offer no explanation for his mount’s disappointing performance and added that the horse, which was having its first race start on the All Weather Track, was not unsuited by racing on this surface.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race which included an endoscopic examination showed a substantial amount of blood in the horse’s trachea and also found the horse to have sustained a mild abrasion to the left front leg.  Before being allowed to race again, MR COOL will be subjected to an official veterinary examination.
Shortly after the start was bumped by HAPPY ACTION which shifted in.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Bumped at the start.  From a wide barrier was shifted across behind runners in the early stages.
No report.

Near the 1000 Metres shifted in and made contact with WHIZZ KID when being steadied to avoid AURORA LADY (J McDonald) which shifted in when not quite clear.  J McDonald was advised to exercise more care.  Bumped leaving the 600 Metres.
Leaving the 900 Metres shifted out when being steadied away from DANCING CODE and as a result made contact with INVINCIBLE SHIELD.
When shifting in near the 1000 Metres got its head up when being steadied by its rider J McDonald.  Raced wide and without cover for the majority of the event.

Jumped only fairly.  After being crossed by INVINCIBLE SHIELD near the 1000 Metres commenced to race keenly and got its head up when being checked to avoid INVINCIBLE SHIELD for some distance thereafter.  In this incident HORSEPOWER shifted out and made contact with MASTEROFMYUNIVERSE.  M Chadwick reported that his mount refused to settle in the early and middle stages.  He said after being held up for clear running in the early stages of the Home Straight he was able to commence to ride his mount along but near the 150 Metres was obliged to check HORSEPOWER to avoid AURORA LADY which was giving ground.  He added after this incident HORSEPOWER finished the race off only fairly.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
Near the 900 Metres was steadied to allow AURORA LADY to cross.  A veterinary inspection immediately following the race did not show any significant findings.
